loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Mariatu from Kambia, in the Northern Province of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. One of her daughters is going to school. Two relatives also live in the home. 

Mariatu runs a general store in her house. She sells palm oil, rice, groundnuts (peanuts) and cooking oil. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. At present, she says, her business is doing well.

Mariatu has requested a loan to buy more food commodities, like palm oil, rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will enable her to increase her business and improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand the business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food commodities, like palm oil, rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother of one child who attends school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 


For the past year Sarah has operated a business selling used clothes, her sole source of income. She works in a shop seven days a week, and her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing price of used clothes in Uganda.


Sarah has requested a loan of 100000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more used clothes such as blouses, jean skirts, trousers and dresses. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land upon which to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes like blouses, jean skirts, trousers and dresses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin, 45, is married with five children. He has spent more than 15 years in rice farming. With this loan, Celestin will buy more fertilizers for use in rice production. The profits from his yield will be used to provide the family’s basic needs.

Note: the agriculture sector accounts for 37 per cent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 per cent of Rwanda's export revenue and, as of 2009, employs approximately 90 per cent of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use in rice production.

loans.name: Edwin David

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edwin no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Edwin trabaja como albañil, el realiza diversas obras de construcción y trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, Edwin cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Edwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará y reforzará una habitación en su vivienda, de esta manera el y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Edwin seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 26 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, Edwin could not study for a career in Civil Engineering but he wanted to.

On his own initiative, Edwin works as a mason, working at diverse building sites and he works approximately 10 hours a day. Edwin believes he is doing well because of his dedication.

Edwin is very grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to the support he can improve and strengthen a room in his home so that his family will have better security and wellbeing, and so he can continue working and struggling to achieve his big dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to pay for materials to improve his housing for better security and wellbeing

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David, vive con su esposa con la cual ya tiene un año de estar casado. El, posee una taller de mecánica automotriz en la Cuidad de Corinto, lo desempeña todos los días y dicha actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeño, asimismo ha tomado clases para desempeñarlo mejor; hoy en día quiere brindar servicio de viaje con moto taxi para mejorar sus ingresos.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar una moto taxi para obtener mayores utilidades, ya que este es un servicio muy rentable y de ayuda para las personas.
Su sueño es que esta nueva actividad que emprenderá, llene sus expectativas  y así ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
David lives with his wife and has been married for one year. He owns a automotive repair shop in the city of Corinto. He works every day and he learned this activity when he was very young. He has also taken classes so he can do it better. 

At this time he wants to offer a motorcycle taxi service in order to improve his income. He is asking for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle taxi in order to obtain higher profits as this is a profitable service and helps people. His dream is that this new activity that he is beginning meets his expectations and provides a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi to provide taxi services

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz De Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZAPATITO VELOZ DE VENTILLA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhanet es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chiflería, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhanet es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio inicio con su madre hace varios años, con el pasar del tiempo decidió continuar con el mismo negocio, ya que es un buen negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito,  ahorro, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Zapatito Velos de Ventilla” is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Jhanet serves as the treasurer.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling low-cost goods, managing a neighborhood store, selling food, and working as a chauffeur.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Jhanet.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization.  Jhanet currently has a business where she sells food.  She started this business after having worked with her mother for several years.  Over the course of time, she decided to continue in the same line of work since it is a good business.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice, noodles, and oil.  She will acquire these supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then use them for making the dishes that she sells from her vending space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Jhanet is in a common-law relationship and has one child.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Jhanet said that she enjoys the loans, the savings, the training seminars, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana  es cliente antigua d ela institución, sigue la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,   cada préstamo que saco con la institución es para el mejoramiento de su actividad, es una cliente responsable y trabajadora, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio ya que creció en su actividad y en clientela y desea brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Mariana is an old client of Emprender. She continues with the same activity of selling meals. She says that she did very well with her last loan that she used to buy ingredients to make her meals. Each loan that she takes through the institution is to improve her business. She is responsible and hardworking. At this time she is asking for a loan in order to buy tables and chairs for her business as her business has grown and she wants to make her customers more comfortable. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity given her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Pastoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASTORITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de alfombras, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de lana, elaboración de sogas, venta de carne, venta de api, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de busos y medias; este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar la demanda de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en grupo y el asesoramiento.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Pastoritas” (The Little Shepherds) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Modesta is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as making rugs, selling food, selling clothes, selling wool, making rope, selling meat, selling “apí” (a beverage made from corn), and selling cosmetics.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Modesta. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven months ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house. Modesta currently has a business of making and selling sweatshirts and stockings. She started this business on her own after noticing that there was a demand for these products.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then use this material for making the products she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Modesta is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Modesta said that she enjoys working in a group and with the advisors.

loans.use: to buy wool for making stockings and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married and has one school-going child. She also takes care of her mother. Aisha resides in the family's house, which has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

Aisha has been operating a restaurant for two years. She works six days a week and sells food to all people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more green bananas, beef, and rice. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, beef, and rice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 38 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 9 years and 20 years. She runs a clothing business in Rokupr, the northern area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells wax cotton and jeans.  She says that the main challenge to her business is slow purchasing power during the rainy season.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her children and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 27 years old and married with 1 child aged 5 years. She runs a clothing business in Rokupr in the northern area of Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 7 years and sells different types of baby clothes and blouses.  She says that her business is doing well because she is able to take care of her family out of the profit.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy different types of baby clothes and blouses for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big clothing shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of baby clothes and blouses for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother).

She has a stone quarry business and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to hire men to help in quarrying.  She works in a shop seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to invest in used clothes.

She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to hire men to help in stone quarrying

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 53-year-old Fatmata from Rokupr. She is widowed with 2 children. She began this business to create a permanent source of income. 

Fatmata runs a food stand. She sells palm oil, beans and pepper.  She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week, 12 hours per day. At present she says her business is doing well.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice, and gari (cassava flakes). The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family's status. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice, and gari

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She also generates additional income through selling tomatoes and banana leaves. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease the transportation and also to build a house. She resides in rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more  bunches of green bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Siba Group

texts.en:
Fitnah is the featured borrower of Siba group.  She went along with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Fitnah is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working in selling home products since two years ago to help her husband in making their living and covering their family's increasing expenses.

Fitnah is acquiring a loan in order to increase her merchandise with a new collection of specially released home products so she can please her customers' needs and satisfy their desires.  At the same time she will be increasing her family's income and developing her business.

She is the one sitting at the right side with a white veil. As for the other group members, Sarah is seated in the middle and Rabiha is the one at the left.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of specially released home products

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es: Estela es madre soltera de un hijo de 24 años de edad. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a laborar como auxiliar de enfermería en diferentes clínicas y hospitales, pero debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba, decidió alternar su empleo con la venta de mercancía, con el fin de generar ingresos extra para solventar todos los gastos y necesidades básicas de su hogar, pues toda la carga económica recae directamente sobre ella, porque nunca recibió la colaboración, ni el apoyo del padre de su hijo.  Ella ofrece calzado, bolsos y ropa para dama, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido, ya que depende de los turnos que tenga en su empleo. Estela es una mujer luchadora, dedicada y muy activa, diariamente se esmera por cumplir sus objetivos y sueña con tener un almacén bien acreditado y rentable, y cuando llegue la hora de pensionarse, poder seguir generando ingresos y lograr una estabilidad económica favorable. Esto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, calzado, bolsos) y adecuar el espacio para un vestier; con esto logrará tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo los diversos gustos y necesidades, además podrá brindar un mejor servicio que le permita fidelizar su clientela y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, para dar a su hijo la oportunidad de tener educación universitaria y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is a single mother of a 24-year-old son.  Her entire productive life has been spent working as a nursing assistant at different clinics and hospitals.  Due to a difficult financial situation, she decided to divide her time between her job and selling merchandise in hopes of generating extra income to pay for all of her expenses and basic household needs.  All of the financial responsibilities fall on her because she never received assistance or support from the father of her child. 
 
Estela offers shoes, bags, and clothing for women.  She does not have an established work schedule, since a lot of it depends on the shifts she has work at her job.  Estela is a determined, dedicated, and active woman who strives each day to accomplish her goals.  Her dream is to have a reputable and profitable store.  When she retires, she hopes that such a business will continue generating income so that she can have a decent level of financial stability.  

The reason for requesting this loan is so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise in bulk (blouses, jeans, shoes, and bags) and to create a space for a changing room.  With this loan, she hopes to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and satisfy their tastes and needs.  In addition, she hopes to provide better service so that her customers remain loyal and her sales and income increase.  As a result, she will be able to provide her son the chance to have a university education and to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (blouses, jeans, shoes, and bags) and to create a space for a changing room.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu, 30, is married and has two children, who are seven and ten. 

She runs a textile business in Rokupr, which is in northern Sierra Leone. She has been in this business for three years and sells different kinds of cloth. Her main business challenge is inflation.

Kadiatu has requested a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more wax cotton and different kinds of textiles for resale. The extra income from this loan will help her improve her living conditions and allow her to take care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton and other textiles for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 33 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 4 years and 17 years. She runs a local food business in Rokupr, a northern area in Sierra Leone. She began her business because she need to create an income to be independent 

She’s been in this business for 10 years and sells beans, dry pepper and bulgur. Fatmata says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gari, beans and bulgur.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her house and open a savings account. In the future, she would like to build a big house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gari, beans and bulgur.

loans.name: Jamesetta

texts.en:
Jamesetta is 33 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has a nine-year-old child who is attending school and lives at home. 

Since 2006, Jamesetta has been selling soap, toothpaste, charcoal and other small things. She started frying banana chips and then started trying other products to sell. Sometimes the business is very slow and she has to go to her customers and try to sell.  About having her own business, she likes to contribute to keep her child in school. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending nine hours on her business.

Jamesetta is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise (soap, toothpaste, coal and other items) to resell. For the future, she would like to be an international business women and wants to send her child to university.

She would like to thanks BRAC Liberia supporters.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (soap, toothpaste, coal and other items) to resell

loans.name: Hamiar

texts.en: Hamiar is 27 years old and is a married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a taxi that he uses to earn low daily income.  He makes an effort to provide for himself and his family. His relatives are proud of him because he is a person who has faced the difficult situations that have happened to him. He intends to buy furniture for his house but he doesn't have enough money so he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture. He wishes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 50 years old and lives in Paynesville South which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. Presently she lives alone and has five children aged between 20 and 35. They are currently out of high school and living on their own.

 Over the past fifteen years Theresa has been selling palm oil in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has a lot of customers which can boost her business. She works from Monday to Saturday, spending eight hours on her business. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Emma from Rokupr, Northern area. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 months and 7 years. She began this business because she was wanting to be busy.   

Emma runs a general store at her house; she sells cigarettes, milk, Pure Water and drinks. She has been running this business for the past five years. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.  Emma says that at present her business is doing fine.

Emma has requested a loan in order to buy more Pure Water, bags of milk and other drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more Pure Water, bags of milk and other drinks

loans.name: Emma Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Emma es una mujer de 41 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos están estudiando uno en primaria y el otro en secundaria. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa la cual se dedica a realizar actividades en el campo como limpieza, riego, cote y recolección del grano, entre otros. Ella se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol, café y hortalizas desde hace 6 años actividad que aprendió de su madre y el terreno que ella cultiva es propio el cual lo heredo de su padre. Ella también tiene otros ingresos por parte de la leche de vaca la cual tiene una en casa y le produce 10 botellas diarias las cuales vende a los vecinos y demás que conocen de su producción de leche. Ella sueña con agrandar sus cultivos para obtener una buena y excelente producción cubriendo la demanda que actualmente tiene ya que de esa forma ella podrá obtener mayores ingresos y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y en otras necesidades que se presenten en el diario vivir.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 4 bolsas de nutrí café, 2 bolsas de abono 18-46-0, 4 bolsas de urea, 3 bolsas de abono foliar y 3 bolsas de abono 12-24-12, con lo cual ella podrá asistir sus cultivos y lograr una producción más segura para su venta.
texts.en:
Emma is 41 years old. She is a single mother of 4 children of which 2 are students, one in primary school and the other in secondary.

She is a farmer and homemaker dedicated to farming activities such as cleaning, watering, cutting and harvesting the grain, and more.

She has been working growing corn, beans, coffee and vegetables for 6 years, an activity she learned from her mother. The land she cultivates is her own as she inherited it from her father.

She also has other income from the sale of milk from her dairy cow that she has at home and produces 10 bottles a day which she sells to her neighbors and others who know about her milk production.

Her dream is to enlarge her crops in order to obtain a good and excellent production covering the demand she currently has so that she can obtain higher income and continue supporting her children in their studies and for other necessities that come up in daily life.

She is asking for a loan through COMIXMUL cooperative in order to buy 4 bags of nutrí café, 2 bags of 18-46-0 compost, 4 bags of urea, 3 bags of foliar, and 3 bags of 12-24-12 compost which will help her attend to her crops and achieve a better chance of a good harvest to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee, corn, beans, and vegetable crops

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (her elderly parents). She has a retail shop and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She works in a shop that she rents, seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. 

Fatuma is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also building her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and cooking oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Please meet 27-year-old Olivia from Liberia; presently she lives in Paynesville South which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. Olivia finished 12th grade and she is married. Her husband is a businessman as well; they have two children ages 6 and 8. Her children are currently are attending school and live at home. 

For the past seven years now Olivia has been selling soft drinks, oil, rice, soap, etc. in the local market. She happily explains how she gets a lot of profit and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children. She would like to say thanks to the people around the world who are helping small business people.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business

loans.name: Fehmina

texts.en: Fehmina is 28-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for the past three years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Isatu from Rokupr northern area. She is married with one 4-year-old child. 

Isatu runs a retail business, and she sells fuel. She has been running this business for 5 years. She works at the business throughout the week, from 7:00 a.m. till 7:30 p.m. At present, her major problem is insufficient capital to run her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy fuel to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family. In the future, she plans to open a fuel station. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy fuel to expand her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business selling tomatoes and onions. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions. She works at the market seven days out of every week and on retail basis. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to own a plot of land so as to start growing tomatoes and onions and also to build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Noe Agustín

texts.es:
Noe tiene 48 años de edad, es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y procrearon tres hijos. Vive junto a su compañera de vida y dos nietos de aproximadamente 6 años. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su compañera de vida y sus nietos que van a la escuela,  quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres  para llegar a la parcelas camina 1 Km  y trabaja, mientras su compañera de vida  ordeña las vacas y  vende la leche. Luego en el transcurso de la tarde él cuida los animales en los potreros.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas vacas lecheras y producir mas leche para elaborar lácteos como queso, crema y obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Su propósito es, comprar un terreno donde tener los animales ya que alquila actualmente y le sale mas caro mantenerlos.
texts.en:
Noe is 48 years old and is a person who only studied up to ninth grade.  His life partner makes a living through household chores and has given him three children.  He lives with his life partner and two grandsons who are approximately six years old.  He gets up at 5:00 a.m. along with his life partner and grandsons, who go to school and depend on the work that he does.

Noe makes a living through agriculture, a job that he learned from his parents.  To get to the plots of land he walks one kilometer, and he works while his life partner milks the cows and sells the milk.  Later in the course of the afternoon, he cares for the animals in the pastures.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy more dairy cows and to produce more milk for making dairy products like cheese and cream, and to get a higher income in order to support his family.  His goal is to buy a plot of land where he has animals, because he currently rents and that gets more expensive to maintain.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows and to produce more milk for making dairy products like cheese and cream, and to get a higher income in order to support his family.

loans.name: Bavi

texts.en:
Bavi is 51 years old, a married woman and a mother of three children. For the past 10 years, Bavi has been running a business of milk sales. She is running this business with the help of her husband. She has two buffaloes which she uses for milk sales in her community. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her children to school to get a better education. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 51 years old. She has been a rice farmer for the past thirty years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. With the profits from the produce will be used to renovate the house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is married and has three children and all her children go to school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

She operates a retail shop at the market and has been in this business for seven years. She has no additional source income. She works seven days a week in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of soap, sugar, rice and flour. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, sugar, rice, cartons of salt, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 46 years old. He is married and lives in Zugdidi District with his wife. 

Gocha works in the taxi business. He owns a car and drives locally. He works hard all day long but does not earn enough to ensure that he and his wife have an average standard of living.

Gocha has made multiple loan requests, without success, from local financial institutions to start up a trading business. His loan requests were rejected each time due to his low income. However, Gocha’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit under flexible conditions. Borrowers are the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as "high-risk borrowers."

With the credit, Gocha will purchase soft drinks, tobacco, and chewing gum, and set up a small store. He plans to increase the inventory offered at his store gradually. Gocha's business, financed through a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase his family's income. Through hard work, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions. With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular credit products, should they need it, in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, tobacco, and other products to set up a small store

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 41-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for the past four years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nazran

texts.en:
Nazran is a 36-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and four children. For about six years she has been working doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater more customers consistently. 

It’s her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is hopeful that she will get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Nazran dreams of a bright future for her children and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 45-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will create a means of increasing her revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah is married and has one child who goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (twin sisters and a brother). She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a retail shop and has been in this business for six months. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. 

She is aspiring to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to own a fully stocked retail shop. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar and Irish potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and Irish potatoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 50-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working in the art business for eighteen years.

Hanaa is involved in many areas: she has eight years of experience as a teacher in the Association for the Handicapped, where she taught Arabic language and mathematics. Her main business now is in mosaic and faux-bijoux handicraft work. 
Her husband, a blacksmith, works to earn daily wages and has a fluctuating income.

Hanaa has benefited from financial and non-financial services from Al Majmoua since 2008. She was also chosen by Al Majmoua to attend the "1st Euromed Forum of Women Micro-entrepreneurship" which took place in Strasbourg in November 2008 to link women from Arabic Mediterranean countries, build a network and test the European market responsiveness to handicraft products from the Arab countries.

The forum helped Hanaa to increase her self confidence as she met people from different cultures, and exchanged experiences and new skills with other micro-entrepreneurs. Hanaa also received a great testimony of appreciation of her mosaic work from customers: they were impressed with the high quality of professionalism in her work. 

Hanaa took two loans from Al Majmoua to purchase a ceramic stone-cutting machine and some other work materials. This machine allowed Hana to save 50% on the cost of raw materials and 30% on her time. She previously had to rent one for USD 100 per day.

She has also benefited from many training opportunities from Al Majmoua and was able to become a vocational trainer for her peers in the community. She trains other women to acquire new skills and start a new business. 

Hanaa is very satisfied with what she has learned and accomplished. She feels more confident as she proves herself by participating more and more in the budget and decision-making of her family. 

Unlike her previous loans, Hanna is acquiring a third loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to pay for her daughter's increasing university tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has had a business selling milk for one year. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more milk for resale. She goes door-to-door selling milk on a retail basis five days out of every week. Her major business challenges are the rainy season which hinders her movements. She aspires to get a permanent business location and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house where the family has no access to electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school and rent.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 41 years old. She is married with three children; only two of them go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizer for her rice farm. The profits from the rice will be used to help to sustain the family's needs.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to increase rice production.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian, 34, is married with two children, aged 12 and 17 years old. She runs a cosmetic business in Kambia in the Northern Province of Sierra Leone.

Marian has been in this business since 1992. She sells earrings, cream, wool and makeup. She says the main challenge to her business is slow purchasing power during the rainy season.

Marian has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone. She will use the loan to buy more earrings, cream, wool and makeup for resale. She says the extra income from this loan will help support her children and take care of her family. 

In the future, Marian would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more earrings, cream, wool and makeup for resale.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 23-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two children; one of them is school-going. She wishes to send her both children to school but is unable to cover the expenses.  

Two years ago, she started her own business of cloth sales when she accepted the fact that her husband’s salary is not sufficient to meet their household expenses. She buys printed and embroidered cloth in different colors and designs from the wholesale market at lower rates and then sells them in her community. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. 

She has gradually improved her business, and now she is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of cloth in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of cloth in a larger quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a first time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI), applying for ugx.1,000,000. She is a single mother of two children with whom she lives in one of her brother’s rental units in the outskirts of the city. She operates a food business from her home. This has helped her be able to take care of her children and educate them. Besides looking after her children, she has also managed to buy a small piece of land. Her major challenge is staying in her brother’s small house yet she has mature children. This has forced her to start building a simple house that she would like occupy in the near future. She is constrained by her finances; this is why she is applying for the loan. Her future plan is to work hard, complete her own house and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 50 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is a widow with three children aged between 32 and 37. She stopped her education at first grade. 

For the past five years, she has been selling pig feet in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her sisters and brothers. She enjoys her business because it is the only means by which she is surviving. She sells six days a week, from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. 

Cecelia is requesting a loan to purchase more pig feet for her business. She plans to build a house and a shop in the local market area.

loans.use: to purchase more pig feet for her business

loans.name: Luís René

texts.es:
Don Luís, tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos, aprendió el oficio de ser agricultor y la cría de ganado desde que era muy pequeñito, ya que sus padres no lo mandaron a la escuela, siempre estuvo ocupado en las labores agrícolas, debido a que era la única fuente de empleo de la familia. Todos  los días se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana, para llevar sus reses al potrero, debe caminar unos 2 kilómetros, por la tarde los trae y los encierra en su corral, les da agua y un poco de heno, el resto del día, lo pasa trabajando en su cultivo de yuca y maíz,          

 Para comprar animales de buen encaste, tiene que viajar al tiangue en un camión, el viaje tarda unos 40 minutos, al llegar observa muchos animales, hasta encontrar los que le gustan, después de comprarlos, los sube al camión y retorna a casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar 2 novillos de engorde en repasto. Esto le ayudara a incrementar el número de animales y con esto sus ventas podrán ser mas continuas, como también sus ingresos y con esto podrá dar lo mas necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old. He is married and has 2 children. He learned to work as a farmer and in livestock at an early age since his parents could not send him to school. He was always busy doing agricultural activities since it was the only source of income for the family.

Every day he gets up at 5:00 in the morning in order to take his cattle to pasture, walking about 2 kilometers, and in the afternoon he puts them in their corral, giving them some water and a bit of hay. The rest of the day he spends working on his crops of cassava and corn.

In order to buy good breeding cattle he has to travel to Tiangue in a truck. The trip takes about 40 minutes. He looks at many animals to find those he likes, later buys them, loads them on the truck and returns home.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy 2 young bulls to fatten on his pasture. This will help him to increase the number of animals he has and his sales will continue, as well as his income, and he can provide more of what his family needs.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls to fatten in his pasture.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives in a quiet neighborhood with his parents. For the past few years, Ahmad has owned and run a grocery store. It is located in a very crowded area in the city. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more groceries, like milk and rice and diary products, to resell in his store.This will improve his business and increase his income. Ahmad appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with five children. All of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She takes care of additional family members (mother and orphans). 

She operates a pub in a shop that she rents and has been in this business for four years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, local gin and serving utensils. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and electricity. She aspires to have a permanent shop and stop renting. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda, local gin and serving utensils.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with two children. Both of them go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells second-hand shoes and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis six days a week. She gets additional income from poultry farming and selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality, that is, the rainy season, which hinders her movements, and ever increasing prices of used clothes. 

She aspires to get permanent business premises and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo.
Islam is a 23-year-old married woman from Deir el balah. She is a mother of one son and one daughter. Islam's husband works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income. This income barely covers the family's needs. Islam and her husband would like to improve their home by expanding it. 
Islam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy construction materials so they can build another room and expand their small home. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for another room and expanding their home.

loans.name: Las Poderosas De Ventanilla Alta Group

texts.es:
Esta es la alcancía Las Poderosas De ventanilla Alta
Una de las socias es Brunella de 20 años ella es conviviente y tiene 02 hijas pequeñas. Brunella  trabaja para colaborar con los gastos familiares, por medio de sus amigas empezó a dedicarse  a la venta de productos de belleza. Sus mejores clientes son sus  amistades, familiares y personas que se recomiendan entre sí, son tres años que está vendiendo y le va muy bien, con el credito solicitado podrá comprar más productos para ofrecer a sus clientas. Brunella feliz con su grupo para más adelante desea encontrar un lugar para poner su negocio y vender directamente a sus clientes.
 En la foto es la cuarta de la izquierda, viste casaca color violeta tiene a su bebe cargado.
texts.en:
This is the Communal Bank named “Las Poderosas de Ventanilla Alta”. One of the members is Brunella. She is 20 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two young daughters. Brunella works so that she can contribute toward the family expenses. Her friends suggested that she begin selling beauty products. Her best customers include friends, relatives, and people who have been recommended to her. Brunella has been selling for three years and is doing very well.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products that she can offer to her customers. Brunella is happy with her group. Going forward, she would like to have a place where she can locate her business and sell directly to her customers. In the photo, Brunella is the fourth woman wearing a purple jacket and carrying a baby.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. 

She has been in the rice growing business for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. The profits from the rice produce will be used to provide food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family's income. She has gained five years of experience in this field. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques and she enjoys a great client list. To meet the demands of her customers without fail, she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of buttons and needles. So then she would be able to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Posseh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Posseh from Lunsar Northern area. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 years and 19 years. Her husband is out of work. She began this business to generate income to support the home. 

Posseh sells general stock items at her house. She sells cigarettes, milk, pure water and biscuits. She has been running this business since 1990. She works at the business throughout the week, 12 hours per day. Posseh says that at present she has insufficient capital to expand her business.

Posseh has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, biscuits and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, biscuits and drinks.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 50 years old. He is a father of eight children, and they all go to school. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to build his modern house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a young sister). She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a business of selling beef and has been in this business for one year. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more meat for resale. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more meat for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 40 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is a fifth grade dropout. She and her boyfriend, who is a college student, have three children between 12 and 23 years old. Two of her children are currently in school and they all live at home.

Since 2001 she has been selling palm oil, rice, candy, etc., in the local market. She said her business is in a good place and she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, candy, etc., for her business.

Her plans are to build a house, move from a table business to a shop business, and educate her children. She thanks the lenders for their continuing support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, candy, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 48, lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest port and is the Number 1 commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between the ages of 15 and 28. Two of her children attend high school, one attends college, and all of them live at home. 

Rebecca has been running a restaurant for the past 20 years. She started this business by running a food stall with money from her husband and she learned the business through her friends. Her favorite part of the business is the profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, dried meat, fish, coal, etc., for her business. In the future, she wants to a build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, dried meat, fish, coal, etc.,  for her business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on both a wholesale and retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last 11 years. Hadija has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her major challenge is transportation and price fluctuations. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food. She lives in her own house. The family has access to electricity, but not to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother of three children; all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling clothes and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more skirts, blouses and dresses. She generates additional income by washing people’s clothes. Annet sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She resides in her own house where the family has no access to electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more skirts, blouses and dresses.

loans.name: Marlon De Jesus

texts.es: Don Marlon de 30 años de edad,  es una persona responsable y honesto y dedicado a su trabajo, vive en casa propia con su grupo familia, hace 5 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en las agencia de compra- venta que están cerca d su lugar de residencia con las ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Marlon solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, controle de plagas, etc. y asi obtener mejores ganancias,  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Marlon is 30 years old. He is a responsible and honest person who is dedicated to his work. Marlon lives with his family in their own home. For the past five years, he has been growing corn and beans. He offers his products to the brokers who buy and sell near his home. With the profit he earns, he is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

Don Marlon is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides, pest controls, and other items. As a result, he will be able to earn more income in hopes of providing his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides, pest controls, and other items.

loans.name: Leivin

texts.es: Leivin, tiene la edad de 30 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y un  hijo actualmente. El quiere compra almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leivin is 30 years old. He is married and today lives with his wife and son. 

He wants to buy nursery seeds in order to replant his coffee farm and also to buy some supplies. He says the land needs to be replanted in the damaged areas in order to expand the next crop and to grow as a coffee farmer in the area. He is hoping that with these improvements he can generate a better coffee production and therefore generate earnings so he can move ahead with his project and improve his standard of life.

This is the first loan he has received through FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies and nursery seeds

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 33, is a passionate woman who has been selling clothes for the last eight years. She is a loving mother of three daughters and two sons. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education.

She always has a great collection for women of her community. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of printed and embroidered clothes in different colors and designs to her customers and makes enough money to lead a decent life. 

She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of more clothes in different colors and designs to inflate her sales. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family

loans.use: to buy a stock of more clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 28-year-old Abibatu from Port Loko. She is married with three children between the ages of five and ten. One of her children is currently attending school.

Abibatu runs a retail business selling palm oil, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning until night. At present her major problem is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Abibatu has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to educate her children up to the university level. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trees for making firewood.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 22-year-old single woman who has been working as a mobile hair dresser for four years. She supports her six other family members for whom she is the only breadwinner. She has to make sure that her business is strong enough to cover their needs.

Mariam is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy a car for her business development. She will use it to go from one customer's house to another.

She also expects customers at her house. Her business is based on well-organized time management which helps her reply to customers' needs.

She hopes that one day she can open her own beauty salon and serve her customers at any time.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for her business development.

loans.name: Foto

texts.en:
Foto, 48, lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest port and is the Number 1 commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between the ages of 20 and 30. Only two attend college, and they are all living on their own. 

Foto has been selling fish in the local market for the past 30 years. She started this business with money from her mother and learned the business from her mother. Her favorite part of the business is that it gives her money. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Gunter

texts.es: Gunter, de 58 años, está casado con María y tiene 08 hijos que son mayores de edad, actualemente vive junto a su cónyuge, su hijo y su nuera en su casa propia. Gunter, se dedica a la venta de productos regionales, tiene un terreno agrícola en donde siembra diversos cultivos como coco, naranja, limones y distintas frutas tropicales que cosecha cada dos días y que posteriormente pone a la venta de forma ambulatoria en el mercado principal de la ciudad. En épocas de baja producción la cosecha es semanal y en ese período realiza otras funciones para asegurar su solvencia económica. Lleva en esta actividad más de 02 años y le va muy  bien. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa quien le apoya en las ventas y en la atención a sus clientes.  Por las noches trabaja como guardián de una ganadería que le genera un ingreso económico adicional.Está muy contento porque ambas actividades le están dando buenos resultados, anteriormente su mayor problema era la dificultad que tenía para trasladar sus productos a la ciudad debido a las malas condiciones de la carretera, además la ausencia de mano de obra en su sector no le permitía realizar la cosecha en el tiempo previsto, sin embargo todas esas condiciones han mejorado y ahora trabaja adecuadamente y con mejores resultados. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de distintos productos regionales como yuca, plátano y carnes de animales silvestres ya que ha visto que tienen gran demanda entre la población y no cuenta con estos productos en su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Gunter is 58 years old and married to Maria.  They have eight adult children.  [Gunter] currently lives with his wife, his son, and daughter in law.  He sells regional products, and has farmland where he raises different crops such as coconuts, oranges, lemons, and different tropical fruits that he harvests every two days and then sells in the main city market.

In times of low production, he harvests once a week and does other things to ensure financial solvency.  He has been doing this for more than two years and things are going well for him.  His wife helps with sales and serving customers.  In the evenings he works as a security guard for a day care center, which generates additional income.

He is very happy because both activities are providing him with good results.  Previously his greatest problem was transporting his products to town because of the bad road conditions.  The lack of available labor in his area also did not allow him to harvest as expected.  However all everything has improved and now he works with better results.

This will be his sixth Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financing he receives so he can move forward and promises to make his payments on time.  He is asking for a loan of 800 Soles to buy various regional products such as yucca, plantain, and bush meat, since he has high demand and doesn't have these things on his land.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento OASIS,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Juana  tiene 21 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante visitando ferias y mercados de la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Juana  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria,  su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Juana  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio y también agradecida por sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Oasis is made up of 8 members, all women. The president of the bank is Juana who is 21 years old. She sells seasonal clothing. She sells her merchandise on foot by visiting fairs and markets in El Torno. This is her first loan with the institution.

Juana is going to use the loan to buy wholesale clothing such as sweaters and jackets to supply her business as the cold season is coming and during this season she has many sales and even some orders.

She is asking for a loan due to the lack of capital. She faces challenges in her business such as daily competition. Her desire is to have inventory so that she can offer a variety of clothing to her customers.

Juana is feeling happy and grateful to the lenders for support which allows her to improve her business and also to her communal group companions who in some cases are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married with four children, and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for some time. 

She seeks 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also buying a plot of land and building a house. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a single mother of two children, and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes, and has been in this business for three years. She has generated additional income through weaving baskets. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a permanent business premises and also buying a plot of land so as to build her own house. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: La Hermosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Hermosa está en su ciclo número décimo cuarto del programa de comité. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es Teofila, quien por medio de la costura que hace se esfuerza por ir mejorando sus ingresos y los de su familia. Es consciente que la única forma de poder crecer es con el esfuerzo y con la lucha diaria. Es una excelente costurera que hace todo tipo de confecciones y así se gana honradamente la vida.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called “La Hermosa” (The Beautiful One) is in its 14th loan cycle with the Committee Program. The members have taken a poverty elimination survey and two of them were shown to be below the poverty line. In other words, they have very low incomes.

One of the members is Teofila. She works as a seamstress and strives to improve her earnings for the sake of her family. Teofila is aware that the only way for her to grow is through determination and daily effort. She is an outstanding seamstress who produces all types of garments, thus allowing her to make an honest living.

Teofila is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread. This will allow her to continue working and investing in her microenterprise.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Hermes
