He wants facilities to come to the canton which have alternative ways of diversifying farming, so the area is not dependent only on the most common crops (corn, sorghum, sesame and beans) and therefore there will be less risk of losing the investment made.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, weed-killers and seeds to sow 17,500 square metres of sorghum.

loans.name: Biby

texts.ru: Биби 50 лет. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Биби замужем и имеет 2 детей. Детям 20 и 17 лет. Она работает в государственной организации. Она работает контролёром. Ее муж тоже работает в этой организации, механиком. Биби и ее семья живут бедно. Биби последнее время имеет плохое состояние. Она серьёзна больна. Биби должна срочно лечиться, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. В будущем она мечтает воспитать молодёжь, если ее здоровье позволит.
texts.en: Biby is 50 years old.  She's a diligent and hardworking woman.  She is married and has two children aged 20 and 17.  She works for a governmental organization as a supervisor.  Her husband works for the same organization as a mechanic.  Biby and her family live poorly and recently, Biby has been unwell.  She's seriously ill.  She must undergo treatment immediately but she doesn't have the funds.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 KGS to buy medication for her treatment.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.  If her health returns, she dreams of educating youth in the future.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida, de 56 años, está casada con Cesar de 57 años y tiene 6 hijos, durante mucho tiempo se esforzó arduamente junto a su pareja para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, actualmente vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos, su nuera y su nieta en su casa propia. Zaida se dedica a dar el servicio de rectificaciones de motores, afinamientos, engranajes, reparación de motos, mototaxis y demás, para cumplir esta función tiene su propio taller ubicado en su casa, lugar donde trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo, su labor es netamente administrativa y de atención al cliente, también vende repuestos y accesorios para los vehículos. Lleva en este negocio más de 10 años y le va muy bien. Por otra parte, alquila dos mototaxis que diariamente le genera un ingreso económico fijo. Le gusta su trabajo, pues no le demanda mucho esfuerzo, además está siempre en su casa cumpliendo las funciones de su hogar, ahora espera seguir trabajando para poder agrandar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su séptimo crédito con Kiva, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará herramientas para implementar su taller, además comprará repuestos como cadenas de mototaxis, catalinas de bicicletas, cables, ejes centrales llantas y cámaras.
texts.en:
56-year old Zaida is married to 57-year old Cesar with whom she has six children. For a long time now she has worked really hard alongside her husband to provide her children with a good education. She now lives with her husband and two of the children, as well as a daughter-in-law and granddaughter in their own home.

Zaida works in the family business servicing and repairing vehicles such as cars, motorbike taxis etc. She owns a workshop located in the house where she, her husband and son all work. Her job is mainly administrative and serving customers but she also sells spares and car accessories.

She's had the business for more than ten years and it is doing well. She also rents out motorbike taxis on a daily basis to generate more income. Zaida enjoys her job as it isn't too demanding and she can work from home and do household tasks too. 

She hopes to continue working and expand the business and generate more income. This is her seventh loan with Kiva, and she is grateful to all those who provide financial assistance so she can fulfill her goals. With the S/. 1000 loan Zaida will buy tools for the workshop and more spare parts such as motorbike chains, bicycle chains, cables, axle shafts, tyres, and inner tubes.

loans.use: Buy tools and spare parts such as cables, shafts, tyres.

loans.name: Charllote's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is a married 45-year-old woman who lives in Teshie, Ghana, with her husband and two sons, who are 11 and 7 years old. She is the woman standing on the far left in the photograph.  

Eunice has been selling frozen chicken, pig feet, and cooking utensils for thirteen years with the help of her husband. She started the business with a low profile, selling just cooking utensils, but gradually she expanded. Eunice needs an amount of GHS 1200 to buy a deep freezer so that she can store her chicken and pig feet. Through her last six loans from ID-Ghana and the support of her husband, she has grown her business year after year. She now earns GHS 400 month from her business, but that is not sufficient for her to manage it. 

Eunice dreams of providing better education for her two children. With this loan, she expects to increase her sales, and that income will help ensure their education and welfare. 

The other four members of her group are Diana, Charllote, Tsotsoo, and Patience, who run businesses in fish, provisions, detergent, maize, and ladies footwear, respectively.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer to store chicken and pig feet.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза умная и современная девушка. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она училась в школе отлично и поэтому после окончания средней школы, ее родители дали ей возможность поступить в университет. Дилноза данное время является студенткой 2 курса Государственного Педагогического Университета. Она учится отлично. В свободное время от учебы, она посещает библиотеку. Она читает как современную, так и классическую литературу. Ее родители гордятся ею. Они простые рабочие и не имеют большой доход. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is a smart and modern girl. She is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She did well in school and therefore, after finishing high school, her parents gave her the opportunity to enter the university. 

Dilnoza is currently a second year student at the State Pedagogical University. She studies well. In her spare time, she visits the library. She reads both modern and classical literature. Her parents are very proud of her. They are simple workers and do not have a large income. Dilnoza requests a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay tuition at the university

loans.name: Mirzokarim

texts.ru: Мирзокарим трудолюбивый человек. Ему 46 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети Фарангиз, Бехрузджон, Мехроб и Комрон. Мирзокарим имеет свое кафе. Он изготавливает и продает пирожки и беляши. Его кафе расположено на местном рынке и поэтому он имеет много клиентов. Мирзокарим имеет помощников  по изготовлению пирожков и беляши. Его жена помогает ему по введению бизнеса. Его дети отличники. Его дочь Фарангиз студентка Таджикского Государственного Университета. Его сын Бехрузджон поступил в университет за границу. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор и поэтому запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mirzokarim is a hardworking man.  He is 46 years old, married and has four children--Farangiz, Behruzjon, Mehrob and Komron.  Mirzokarim has his own cafe. He bakes and sells cakes and other goods.  His cafe is located at a local market and he has many clients.  He employs assistants that make his food.  His wife also helps run the business.  His children are honors students.  His daughter Farangiz is a student at Tajikistan State University.  His son Behruzjon is studying at a university abroad.  Mirzokarim must pay his son's tuition and is asking for a loan of $6,000 to do so.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат добрая и ответственная женщина, а также заботливая и любящая мать 3 детей. Ей 38 лет. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Саодат является основной опорой для своих детей. Саодат более 4 года работает в частной компании в качестве менеджера по продажам. Саодат полученную зарплату для содержания своих детей. Она должна купить школьные принадлежности и школьные формы для своих детей, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Saodat is a good and responsible woman, and also a caring and loving mother of three children. She is 38 years old. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Saodat is the main support for her children. 

Saodat has worked in a private company as sales manager for more than four years. Saodat's salary goes to providing for the children. She needs to purchase school supplies and school uniforms for her children, but does not have the money. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms and school supplies for her children

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ей 39 лет. Гуландом всю свою жизнь посвятила своей семье. Она всегда уделяла большое внимание для образования своих детей. Она более 4 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она предоставляет услуги швеи. Гуландом любит своё дело и шьёт красивые женские платья. Она имеет умелые руки. Гуландом помогла сыну поступить в университет после окончания средней школы. Он уже студент 3 курса. В этом году ее дочь окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Технический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Гуландом должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulandom is a woman with a beautiful soul and beautiful thoughts.  She is married and has three children.  She is 39 years old.  She has dedicated her whole life to her family and has always spend much time focusing on her children's education.  She has had her own business for more than four years, offering services as a seamstress.  Gulandom loves her work and creates beautiful dresses with her skilled hands.  She helped her son begin studying at a university once he finished high school and is already a junior.  This year, her daughter graduated high school and matriculated at Tajikistan State University.  Gulandom must pay her daughter's tuition but doesn't have the funds to do so.  She is asking for a loan to cover the costs.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s education

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She describes herself as honest. She operates a clothes stall, where she sells second hand clothes. 

She will use the KES 11,855 loan to purchase a gas burner and a 13 kg gas cylinder that will benefit 3 family members. The family faces a challenge due to the high cost of fuel. The gas burner will enable them to improve their cooking since they normally use firewood to cook, which produces a lot of smoke. 

Pamela hopes that in the future, she will have an improved life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a gas burner and a 13kg gas cylinder.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with five children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business, and has been in this business for 5 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more charcoal, chicken, rice, bunches of green bananas, and sweet potatoes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in a shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to earn enough profit to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, chicken, rice, bunches of green bananas, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 42 года. Она давно занимается земледелием. Более 20 лет. Она занимается выращиванием лука и пшеницы. Ее муж помогает по введению бизнеса. Она имеет 3 детей и всегда старается для их благополучия. Мухаббат решила дать высшее образование своему сына, как трудно ей не пришлось. Ее сын Мухриддин поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Он поступил на Экономический факультет. Мухаббат должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 42 years old. She has long worked with agriculture, for more than 20 years. She grows onions and wheat. Her husband helps her with managing the business. She has three children and always strives for their well-being. 

Muhabbat decided to give her son higher education, even if it was difficult to her. Her son, Muhriddin, started at the Khujand State University. He entered the Faculty of Economics. Muhabbat needs to pay the tuition for her son, but does not have money. She requests a loan to pay the tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education at the university

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар умная и порядочная молодая леди. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет с мамой. Ее отец умер несколько лет назад. Ее мать работает товароведом в частной организации и еще дополнительно занимается бизнесом для того, чтобы зарабатывать достаточно денег для образования своих детей. Нилуфар данное время является студенткой 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Она учится в юридическом факультете. Нилуфар учится отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Она читает много книг. Нилуфар должна оплатить учебный договор, но ее мать не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nilufar is an intelligent and decent young woman.  She is 19 years old, not yet married and lives with her mother.  Her father died several years ago.  Her mother works as a saleswoman for a private company and also has other jobs to save for her children's education.  Nilufar is a sophomore at Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business.  She is studying law.  She is an honors student and actively participates in her university's community.  She reads many books.  Now she must pay her tuition but her mother doesn't have the money to do so.  She is asking for a loan to cover the cost of her classes.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete his floor and paint his household

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel, es un joven de 24 años,  muy emprendedor y vive con su compañera de vida, Ella se dedica al oficio de la casa  y cuida a su  hija de 4 años, Don Daniel, decidió aprender el oficio de crianza de ganado de engorde en repasto, pero también se dedica a otras actividades productivas como la siembra de pipían, maíz, compra y venta de leche y sus derivados, tiene una prensa para secar queso.  Inicia la jornada de trabajo a las 5:30 de la mañana, comprando la leche  a los vecinos de su comunidad, que tienen vacas de ordeño, al concluir la compra, viaja en su vehículo hasta la ciudad, para venderla a los comerciantes mayoristas, y deja ciertas cantidades para procesarla en su casa.        

para comprar sus novillos de engorde, viaja en un camión de los que salen de su comunidad hasta el tiangue, el viaje tarda 45 minutos, al llegar observa con mucho cuidado, hasta conseguir los mejores novillos, al realizar la compra que puede tardar medio día, viaja de regreso a casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 novillos de engorde en repasto.  De esta manera, incrementara el lote de novillos, esto será de mucho beneficio, ya que las ventas de ganado serán mas continuas y por consiguiente, sus ingresos aumentaran para seguir trabajando. 

Esta seguro que teniendo mayores ingresos, podrá trabajar por mucho tiempo, para aportar a su familia todo lo necesario para subsistir y ahorrar, para construir su casa, ya que actualmente vive en casa ajena.
texts.en:
Daniel is a enterprising young man who is 24 years of age. He lives with his partner, who is a housewife and takes care of their four-year-old daughter.

Don Daniel decided to learn the trade of raising and fattening cattle by grazing. He also pursues other productive activities such as growing pumpkins and corn, buying and selling milk and other dairy products, and maintaining a press for drying cheese. His workday begins at 5:30 A.M. when he buys the milk from neighbors in his community who own dairy cows. To complete the process, he travels in his vehicle to the city so that he can sell the milk to wholesale vendors, but he sets aside a certain amount that he can process at home.

When he purchases steers for fattening, he travels by truck to the community of El Tiangue, which is a 45 minute trip. When he arrives, he inspects the animals with great care so that he can choose the best ones. Once he makes his purchase, it can take him up to half a day for him to return home.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy four steers for fattening. This will enable him to increase his herd of cattle, which will be a great benefit because he can continue to make more sales. As a result, his earnings will increase and he can continue working.

Daniel is confident that he will earn more income since he is able to put in a lot more hours into his work. This will enable him to support his family by providing for all of their basic needs and establishing some savings so that they can build a house. They currently live in someone else's home.

loans.use: to buy four steers for fattening.

loans.name: Cristina Francisca

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 63 años,  trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella atiende alrededor de 20 clientes en el día y trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; ella cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y tiene una rica sazón.

Cristina agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar gaseosas, agua mineral y golosinas al por mayor para ofrecerlas en su negocio; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño” Darle una buena profesión a sus 2 hijos”.
texts.en:
Cristina is 63 years old. She works in her small business selling food. She attends to about 20 customers a day and works around 10 hours a day. She thinks she is getting ahead in business because she is friendly with the customers and has tasty food.

Cristina is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders as thanks to the help she could buy soft drinks, mineral water, and candies at wholesale to sell in her business. This is how she can improve her income and continue fighting in order to achieve her biggest dream of “providing her children with a good profession.”

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, and more for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a batch of perfumes to sell in her business

loans.name: Zidah's Group

texts.en:
Zidah's group is comprised of 6 hardworking young women. Zidah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Zidah has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Zidah has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more baby wares to sell, and will help Zidah to generate greater profits and supplement her business. She hopes to become a self-employed entrepreneur. 

Zidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more baby wares to sell.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар является оной из трудолюбивых женщин горного Таджикистана, которая занимается земледелием. Несмотря на тяжелый труд и жаркие солнечные дни, она работает упорно с раннего утра на поле. Она должна прокормить свою семью. Ее муж Сайфулло помогает ей по выращиванию сельхоз культур как лук, пшеница, арбуз и т.п. Она имеет 1 ребенка. Мунавар уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой старый дом, который имеет плохое состояние. Она не имеет сбережения, чтобы купить строительные материалы и отремонтировать дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесину, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Munavar is one of those hardworking women of mountainous Tajikistan who earns her living in agriculture.  In spite of the heavy labor and hot, sunny days, from early morning Munavar works tirelessly in the fields.  She has to feed her family.  Her husband, Saifulo, helps her grow crops like onions, wheat, watermelon, etc.  Munavar has one young child.   For several years Munavar has been planning to repair their house, which is old and in bad condition.  She doesn't have savings with which to buy the building materials and repair their house.  

Munavar is requesting a loan of 5,000 somini (TJS) to buy building materials such as cement, lumber, paint, etc.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cement, wood, paint for repairing house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger pots and a blowtorch for his candy-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Matu

texts.en:
This is Matu, from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County, which is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of its good roads, quietness, and lower rents.  
       
Matu is 22 years old. She completed 6th grade and is married to a teacher. Together they have a seven-year-old child who is attending school and lives at home. Matu sells cassava, coal by the bag, and corn. She learned this business by working for her friend nine years ago. Matu is requesting a loan of 12,000 Liberian dollars to buy more cassava, coal by the bag, and corn to increase her sales. She reports that the rainy season is the biggest challenge she faces since she does not have an indoor shop. She values her business because it makes her independent and through it she earns her own money. 

Her dream is to live a better life, and she hopes that one day her child can become president. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, coal by the bag, and corn to increase her sales.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 to 13. She describes herself as focused and determined. 

She operates a clothes store where she sells second hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a marketplace, and her primary customers are civil servants. 

Felista will use the KES 29,880 loan to buy iron sheets for roofing that will enable her to harvest rain water. Her family faces a challenge of insufficient water for household use. Her business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing that will enable her to harvest rain water.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она окончила среднюю школу с отличием. Она участвовала на олимпиадах и получила несколько грамот. Она с детства мечтала стать медиком и поэтому она поступила в Медицинский Колледж по специальности гинеколога. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту. В будущем она мечтает служить своему народу.
texts.en:
Gulandom is a hard working young woman.  She is 18 years old, not married, and lives with her parents.  She finished secondary school with excellent marks and took part in the olympiads, winning several honors.  Since early childhood, she has dreamed of becoming a doctor and with this goal she entered the Medical College, where she is specializing in gynecology.

Gulandom needs to pay her tuition, but she does not have the money.  She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.  It is her dream to one day serve the people of her country.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition at the Medical Collage

loans.name: Guillermo Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Guillermo tiene 34 años y es soltero, el se dedica al servicio de publicidad grafica y comercial, el vive en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Guillermo va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de un 
equipo de computación de última generación
 por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere actualizar su equipo de trabajo para realizar un trabajo de  buena calidad  que por la falta de efectivo no la podía comprar y el préstamo le hacía mucha falta, El Sr. Guillermo va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando equipos y materiales que necesita y su deseo es tener una de las agencias de publicidad más cotizadas con todos los equipos modernos para brindar a su clientela un servicio de calidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Guillermo is 34 years old and single. He provides advertising and commercial graphic services. Guillermo lives in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. This loan is his first transaction with Emprender. Sr. Guillermo will use the loan to buy state-of-the-art computer equipment for his business. His reason for requesting this loan is because he wants to have equipment that will enable him to do work of good quality, but he lacks the funds to make this purchase. Therefore, he is in dire need of a loan.

By utilizing the benefits of this loan, he can proceed with buying equipment and materials that he needs. His wish is to have one of the most esteemed advertising agencies. By having modern equipment, he will be able to provide his clients with quality service.

loans.use: to buy state-of-the-art computer equipment for his advertising agency.

loans.name: Chorshanbe

texts.ru: Чоршанбе скотовод и фермер из района Шахритус. Он 48-летний женатый мужчина, имеет шестерых детей в возрасте от 19 до 27 лет. Его дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Чоршанбе в течение 7 лет занимается растениеводством. Он на орошаемом участке земли выращивает овощи. Одновременно Чоршанбе разводит крупнорогатый скот. Конечно же дети помогают отцу в деятельности. Чоршанбе сейчас просит кредит для сезонного посева. Он хочет купить семена лука для посадки. В середине осени Чоршанбе планирует собрать урожай и получить хорошую прибыль с продажи лука, так как в это время все жители будут делать припасы лука на зиму.
texts.en:
Chorshanbe raises cattle and farms in the Shahrituz region.  He is 48 years old, married, and has six children ranging in age from 19 to 27.  His children are already grown and independent.  Chorshanbe has been growing crops for seven years.  He grows vegetables on an irrigated plot of land.  At the same time he raises cattle.  Of course, his children help their father with his business.

Chorshanbe is requesting a loan for this season's sowing.  He wants to buy onion seed.  Chorshanbe plans to gather the harvest in mid autumn and earn a good profit from the sale of the onions since at that time people will be buying onions to save for the winter.

loans.use: to buy onion seed

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Orquideas De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Dúo Solidario Orquideas de Sumpango
este grupo esta conformado por la señora Jelen Marcela de 37 años de edad, ella desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comida ya que este negocio ha sido de mucha yuda para ella y su familia, esta muy contenta ya que sus clientes han aumentado y ellanececita tener mas capital para invertir, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion y venta de comida.
texts.en:
“Orquideas de Sumpango” Solidarity Group

This group includes Sra. Jelen Marcela.  She is 37 years old and has been preparing and selling food for four years.  This business has been a great help to her and her family.  Jelen Marcela is very pleased that her clientele has increased.  She needs more capital to invest, so she is requesting this loan in order to buy food products for preparing and selling her dishes.

loans.use: to buy food products for preparing and selling her dishes.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a Kiva borrower who operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She describes herself as patient. She will use the loan of 6,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase a solar lamp that will light her house, which benefits her four family members and three members of her community. They do not have access to electricity, hence the need for solar energy. This lamp will enable them reduce fuel costs and phone charging costs because they will be able to charge their phones at home.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp for lighting her house.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela lives in the Samtredia District. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and their 7-year-old son. Bela works as an apothecary at the pharmacy and earns a small monthly salary. Her husband is employed at the local railway station and earns monthly income as well. The couple works hard all day long but their young family needs more, so Bela has decided to start up a fast food café to earn additional income. 

Several times, she has requested loans from local credit providers, but her loan requests are always rejected because she lacks experience in starting new businesses. Her current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With this loan, Bela will start up a fast-food café. She will rent the space, and purchase all needed inventory and raw materials to sell sandwiches, pies, and fizzy drinks. Bela hopes her business will be profitable and that she will attract many customers since there is no similar café nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Bela will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start up a fast food cafe.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 37-year-old married man who has four children. He describes himself as persevering and focused. For the last 18 years, Salim has operated a tailoring shop where he repairs clothes. His business is located in a marketplace where his primary customers are civil servants. He reports that competition is his biggest business challenge. 

Salim will use the loan of 23,910 Kenyan shillings to buy iron sheets for his roof that will enable him to harvest rainwater. His family faces a challenge in that they have insufficient water for their household. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for his roof that will enable him to harvest rainwater.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is 21 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Edisa has been working hard to manage her business, where she brews a drink called malwa from millet. 

To help expand her business, Edisa has requested a loan of 150000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more millet for brewing, and will help Edisa generate greater profits by expanding her business and increasing sales. Edisa hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another separate business. 

Edisa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more millet for brewing the drink malwa.

loans.name: Alma Aholibana

texts.es: Alma Aholibana de 50 años de edad, desde hace años ella se ha dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan, le da gracias a Dios por haberle dado la oportunidad de tener su negocio ya que la ha sido de mucha ayuda para ella y su familia, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de un horno para la elaboracion de pan, ya que el unico horno que tiene no se da a basto para sacar la cantidad de pan que ella nececita para venderles a sus clientes,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito ya que solo de esta forma ella podra seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Alma Aholibana is 50 years old, for many years she has worked in making and selling bread, she is thankful to God for giving her the opportunity to have her own business which has been very helpful for her and her family, she is requesting this loan to buy an oven to make bread, this is because the only oven she has is not enough to bake the amount of bread she needs to sell to her customers, she is hoping that you can help with the loan, as this is the only way she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy an oven for bread making

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 55 años está divorciada y tiene 05 hijos, sin embargo comparte su casa propia solo con el menor de ellos ya que sus demás hijos son personas adultas e independientes. Martha se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como panes, té, huevos, harina, arroz, verduras y otros, tiene su tienda instalada en un espacio de su casa y funciona más de 03 años. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos con quienes se siente feliz de compartir una actividad laboral que los beneficia a todos. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para poder realizar diversas actividades sin descuidar ninguna de ellas, la venta de abarrotes le genera ingresos económicos diarios suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia. Espera que sus negocios sigan aumentando en producción y rentabilidad por el bien de su familia y por tranquilidad. Este es su décimo crédito con Kiva, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 800 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, plátanos y otros.
texts.en:
Martha, 55, is divorced and has five children.  Nevertheless, she lives in her own house with only the youngest of them because the others are independent adults.

Martha makes a living selling food such as bread, tea, eggs, flour, rice, vegetables, and other products.  Her store's set up in a space in her house and she has had it for more than three years.  She has the help of her children, with whom she's happy to share a job that benefits all of them.

She likes her job because it allows her to use her time to do a variety of activities without neglecting any of them.  Selling groceries generates enough daily income to cover her family's expenses.  She hopes her businesses keep increasing in size and profitability for her family's welfare and her peace of mind.

This is her tenth Kiva loan.  She's grateful to all the people that make it possible to carry out her plans.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 800 soles [PEN] she'll buy rice, sugar, bananas, and other products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
This is Miatta from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County, which is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of its good roads, quietness, and lower rents. 

Maitta is 25 years old and single. She has two children living at home, ages 2 and 5 years old, one of whom is attending school. For the last six years, she has been running a table business at which she sells frozen chicken. She is requesting a loan to buy more frozen chicken to increase her sales. She started this business with a little money from her mother and she enjoys it because it earns her money.

Miatta plans to open a saving account and help support her household. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more freezing chicken to increase her sales.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is Musu from Liberia; she lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming a more populated community in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads, quiet, and lower prices of house rent.

Musu is 25 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 6.  They live at home and are in school.  For the past four years, Musu has been selling  slippers and cosmetics in the local market; she sells from Monday to Saturday.  

One of her main challenges she faces is that the prices of slippers and cosmetics are very high.  She started this business of slippers, and learned about business from her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and cosmetics for her business.  She plans to build her house and attend college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Livio Juan

texts.es:
Livio es un hombre de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Livio trabaja como obrero en una empresa avícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Livio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará y reforzara su vivienda con materiales adecuados y resistentes, así pues Livio brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Livio is a 27-year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and four children. He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic individual. All of his efforts are focused on helping his family move forward.

Through his own initiave, Livio obtained a job as an employee at a poultry company in the city. He works approximately 10 hours every day and believes he is doing well because of his dedication and the friendly way he treats other people.

Livio is very appreciative of the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support they have provided, he will be able to improve and reinforce his home with adequate materials and waterproofing. As a result, Livio can provide greater security and improved well-being for his family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Abeterine Group Kashagali

texts.en:
Medard is a 33-year-old married man with four children, all of whom attend school and whose school fees he pays. Medard is the man in the red shirt on the far left of the photograph. He is a peasant farmer who grows sugarcane for local gin brewing as his major source of income. He also grows other crops for personal and commercial use.

Medard's group has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings, and he will use his portion to expand his sugarcane plantation by planting more acres that will bring greater returns. His dream is to buy a vehicle to make transporting his sugarcane from the plantation easier.

Medard is faced with a problem of limited capital and the price fluctuation in the local gin market. He needs funding to see his business expand and yield more profits.

loans.use: to plant more sugarcane.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her space and to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Collen

texts.en: Collen is a Kiva borrower. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy cement, iron sheets, and other materials to construct a ventilated improved pit toilet that will benefit her six family members. They face a challenge of poor infrastructure and a poor sewage system. With this toilet, they will be able to improve hygiene and have proper sanitation. She is looking forward to having her dreams fulfilled.

loans.use: buy cement, iron sheets, and other materials to construct a household toilet.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is married with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. 

Ndoro operates a butcher business, where he sells to his neighbors and passersby out of his home. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. With the loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more cow, poultry, and goat meat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cow, poultry, and goat meat for resale.

loans.name: Fennie J.

texts.en:
Fennie J. is 43 years old, and she lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado County due to things such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental housing. 

Fennie J. is married, and has four children between the ages of 4 and 14; they live at home and attend school. She stopped her education in eighth grade. 

For the past two years, she has been selling oil, pepper, rice, etc in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother; she enjoys her business because it gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 5 pm, and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, etc for her business. 

Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, etc for her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 30 years old and lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado County because of things like good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental housing.
 
Fatu is married and her husband is a businessman; they have three children between the ages of 6 to 12 years old who are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past fourteen years, she has been selling frozen chicken, cows feet, pigs feet, and meat, etc... in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit, and has many customers.  Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase more frozen chicken, cows feet, pigs feet, and meat, etc... for her business. 

Her plan is to build a house and educate her children. She would like to say thanks to the donors of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken, cows feet, pigs feet, and meat, etc... for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish showcases

loans.name: Sidheswari Mm Group

texts.en: Sidheswari MM was formed with seven members in 2009 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Gitanjali as the leader of their group. The lady sitting second from the right side of the photograph is Gitanjali. She is a 31-year-old woman living with her husband and her two children. For the last seven years, Gitanjali’s husband has been working as a farmer to manage his small family. It is not sufficient to manage the family. So Gitanjali is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in farming and selling vegetables and paddy in the market. She has four years experience in this business. She has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds and plants, fertilizers, pesticides, and other advanced tools for farming, so that she can support her family’s income. Gitanjali says that by selling vegetables, she can support her family and she can send her children to a good school. Through that, she can provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and plants, fertilizers, pesticides, and other advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 28 years old and lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado County because of things such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental housing. 

She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10.  Two of her children are currently in school, while one is still young to attend school; they all live at home.

For three years Maima has been selling fashion-slippers in the local market, where she enjoys the location of her business since its situated in a very good position not far from the road. She has many customers and the need for her products is very high, although sometimes business is slow. Most of  the time she makes good money.

Maima is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion-slippers to sell; this will enable her to earn more money since the demand from her customers is very high. 

In the future she plans to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion-slippers to sell.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa is 25 years old and lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of things such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental housing. 

She is married and her husband is a businessman; they have two children ages 11 months and 8 years who live at home.  One attends school. 

For the past four years, Massa has been selling oil, onion, soap, and pepper. She started this business with money from her husband. She has some problem with insufficient inventory. 

She requesting a loan to purchases oil, onion, pepper, etc... for her business. 

She likes her business because it helps her save money. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchases oil, onion, pepper, etc.. for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Please to meet 23-year-old Lucy from Liberia. Specifically, she lives in Caldwell. She is single and has two children between the ages of one and three. Only the oldest child is in school but both of them live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling soap. She started her business with money that she was saving. She is requesting a loan to purchase washing soap and bath soap for her business. She sells six day in a week, spending nine hours on her business. She plans to one day own a shop and improve her children's lives in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase washing soap and bath soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Juah

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Juah from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County, which is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of its good roads, quietness, and lower rents. Juah is married with three children, who are between the ages of 2 and 16 years old, and who live at home and attend school. 

For the past seven years, she has been selling palm oil, pepper, onion, and other items in the local market, where she works ten hours a day from Monday through Saturday. One of her main challenges is that sometimes the prices for her goods drop after she purchases them. Juah is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, pepper, onion, and other items for her business. She hopes to one day build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, pepper, onion, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 43-year-old married woman with two children who are two and six years old. She describes herself as warm and social. 

Jacinta operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, bananas, carrots, and other items. She will use the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a water tank that will benefit her four family members, who currently face a challenge of insufficient water storage facilities. With this tank, they will be able to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank so her household can store clean water.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 33 years old; she lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of things such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental housing.

Patience is married and has four children between  the ages of 3 months and 13; three of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. 

For the past 12 years she been selling rice, sugar, beans, etc. A problem she faces is the high wholesale price. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, beans, etc.. for her business.  She likes her business because it has helped her feed her children and sent them to school. 

Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, etc.. for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella se dedica a su pequeño negocio e venta de abarrotes, el cual inicio luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro;  Ana con el fruto de su trabajo solventa los gastos de su hogar, es por ello que trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y sobre todo atiende de manera amable a sus clientes.

Ana esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y de esta manera abastecer su negocio y ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingreso y luchar por hacer su sueño realidad :” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the city of Ica and has her own business selling groceries, which she started through a lot of effort and savings. With the money from her business Ana pays for her household costs; this is why she works for around 10 hours per day and can serve up to 15 customers daily. She thinks her business is going well because she offers high-quality products and particularly because she serves her customers in a friendly way.

Ana is grateful to the Kiva loaners because thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business in order to stock her business and give better service to her customers, which will allow her to increase her income and fight to make her dream a reality: "finishing building her house made from durable materials".

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 31 years old and lives in Caldwell. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado County due to some options such as good roads, quietness, and lower prices for house rent. Marie is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 10 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours on her business. Some of the main challenges she faces are the high price of fresh fish and not many consumers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh bonnie and snapper fish for her business. She plans to save and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh bonnie and snapper fish to sell

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.en: Hermenegilda works in her restaurant business and prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. She has had her restaurant for five years and has been very successful.  She usually buys her ingredients wholesale. She buys noodles, sugar, rice, and oil, all at wholesale, so she can get them at cost. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying ingredients wholesale.  She's happy about the loan and pledges to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale prices

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
This is Oretha from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County, which is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of its good roads, quietness, and lower rents.  

Oretha is 40 years old and is married to a contractor. They have three children between the ages of 15 and 25 years who live at home. One of their children is currently attending school. For the last fifteen years, Oretha has sold peppers, cooking oil, sardines, biscuits, and other items in the local market, where she works eight hours per day from Monday to Saturday. The rainy season is a main challenge for her, but she makes more profit during this time. Oretha learned the business from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, cooking oil, sardines, biscuits, and other items for her business. She plans to build a house for her family and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, cooking oil, sardines, biscuits, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Patience S.

texts.en:
This is Patience S. from Liberia.  She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado due to factors such as good roads, quiet surroundings, and lower housing rental prices. 

Patience S. is 32 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 3 and 10.  They  live at home go to school.  For the past ten years, she has been
selling  fashion clothes in the local market from Monday to Saturday. One of the main challenges that she faces is that the price of fashion clothes is very  high.  She started this business of buying fashion clothes for her mother, and learned the business from her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.  She plans  to build her house and attend college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business,

loans.name: La Confiance (1) Group

texts.en:
Patrick is one of the members of the group La Confiance (1). He is the leader of a group consisting of eight micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Patrick is married with a total of eight children! They range in age from 4 to 18 years old. This is Patrick's very first loan cycle with HOPE Congo and he is looking forward to expanding his shop and business, which he has been running since 2003. Patrick says his biggest challenge so far is the increasing prices that he must pay for the inventory for his store and states that this loan will help to reinforce the total capital of his business. Patrick also loves to talk about Jesus with other people in his community and his loan group.

In the future, Patrick hopes to continue to grow his activities so that he can increase his current shop and ultimately to become a successful businessman in Brazzaville. He would love for his future business to provide him with the opportunity to travel abroad to other countries.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell including soap, milk, corned beef, and candy

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads, quietness, and lower prices for house rent.
 
Beatrice is 30 years old, married and has an eight-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. She has been running a table business where she sells soap and coal for eight years now. She is requesting a loan to buy more soap and coal to increase her sales. She started this business with a little money from her mother. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit. Her plans are to open a store and educate her child. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more soap and coal to sell

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one daughter, Ruth, four years of age.

Karina belongs to Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank. She makes and sells fried potatoes with either hot dogs or chicken, a  very successful business she has had for one year.  She usually buys all of her ingredients (potatoes, hot dogs, chickens, rice, oil) wholesale and is requesting this loan to buy more such ingredients wholesale.  

Karina is happy about the loan and pledges to make her payments punctually. 

Karina was born in the district of Challambamba but lives in the community of Jajahuana, located in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en:
Eulogio is 36 years old, is in a live-in relationship and has six children. 

He belongs to Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank and their main economic activities are agriculture and livestock. He needs this loan to buy more animals, such as bulls and cows. He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his repayments punctually.

He was born in the community of Jajahuana and lives in the community where he was born. (Jajahuana is located in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú)

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
This is Finda from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County, which is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of its good roads, quietness, and lower rents. Finda was unable to attend school herself but she sought out a business to improve her living condition. She was married young and has two children, ages two and four years old, who live at home. One of her children is in school.
 
For the last seven years, Finda has been selling lappa, a popular local garment, and slippers in the local market. One of her main challenges is that she has little capital, since the prices of slippers and lappa go up everyday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and lappa for her business, and she wishes to one day own a house, be independent, and turn her business into a store. She is glad to be a borrower of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more garments for her business.

loans.name: Rugashali Tukole Group

texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, and is married with five children ages 15,13,11, 9, and 1 years old. Four of her children attend school and her husband pays their tuition. She is the woman standing at the far left in the first row of the photograph. Maria has worked as a farmer for the last 15 years, which is her major source of income supporting her family. She also operates a small retail shop at home to add to her earnings.

Maria has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings for her farming activities, which she will use to buy mulch for her banana plantation and pay workers to plow it. Maria's dream is to buy a motorcycle to help carry manure to the banana plantation and to transport her children to school.

Her major challenges are limited capital, the bad weather that affects local agriculture, and price fluctuations in the market. Maria thanks Kiva for being their savior in a time of need.

loans.use: To buy mulch and plow the banana plantation that supports her family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Please meet Mary who is from Liberia.  In particular, she lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the mostlated communities in Mntserrado due to factors such as good roads, quiet surroundings, and lower price of housing rent.
        
Mary is 39 years old, has completed grade 9th, and is married to a businessman.  They have two children aged 13 and 16, who are presently attending school and live at home. For 11 years she has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business by selling to her friends. She complains that the rainy season is the biggest challenge she faces since she does not have a good business location. She likes her business because it makes her independent, and she is so proud of her business because she handles her own money. She is asking for a loan to buy fish to resell. Her dream is to live a better life in the future, and hope that one day her children will become the Presidents. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: La Confiance (2) Group

texts.en: Cesar is one of the members of the group La Confiance (2). He is the leader of the group, which consists of eight micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Cesar is married with three children, ranging in age from 3 to 16 years old. This is Cesar's very first loan cycle with HOPE Congo and he is going to use his loan to purchase a used vehicle that he will disassemble for used parts to resell to his customers. One of the challenges that Cesar faces since he started his business in 2004 is that often his customers are looking for unique items to purchase from his store and it is difficult to find the necessary stock when customers ask for parts. The purchase of the vehicle will allow him to offer more parts, especially unique parts, to his clients. In the future, Cesar hopes to continue to grow his activities and diversify into activities other than spare vehicle parts. Additionally, the increased income that he hopes to earn from his business will be put towards constructing a new home for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a previously used car to use as additional spare parts for his store

loans.name: Batu

texts.en:
This is Batu from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County, which is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of its good roads, quietness, and lower rents. 

Batu is 25 years old, and is married with two children who are two and six years old. Her children live at home and her older child attends school. For the past three years, she has been selling fish in the local market, where she works ten hours per day from Monday to Saturday. One of her main challenges is that sometimes the price of fish is high. 

Batu is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She hopes to one day build a house for her children and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sara from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County, which is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado because of its good roads, quietness, and lower rents. 

Sara is 45 year old, and is married to a businessman. They have four children between the ages of 18 and 25 years. Four of their children live at home and currently attend school. For more than fourteen years, Sara has sold used clothes in the local market, where she works ten hours per day Monday to Saturday. Her main challenge is that she started the business during the rainy season, but she has earned some profit. Sara learned the business from her friends, and started it with money from her husband. 

Sara is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. One day, she plans to build a house for herself and educate all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Nget is aged 47 years and widowed. She has one child. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 10 years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Nget has never been with VisionFund, but now she is leading her group to applying for her first loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is 39 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 18. In 2004, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Dipa plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Los Cafetaleros Group

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio esta casado, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres eran de escaso recursos económicos, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 1 esta estudiando, se dedica a la siembra de café, inició este negocio comprando una plantas y se dio cuenta que le generaba ganancias, a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante que lo utilizará para abonar sus 15 cuerdas de siembra de café, desea en el futuro contar con mas cantidad de terreno para poder sembrar mas y asi obtener mejores ganancias. Los demás integrantes del grupo se decian a la agricultura. En la fotografía aparecen 11 integrantes, pero, solamente a 8 de ellos se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Gregorio is married and is 48 years old.  He did not have an opportunity to get an education because his parents were poor.  He has 5 children, one of whom is in school.  He is a farmer who cultivates coffee.  He started this business by buying some plants, and he realized that they could generate earnings.  At this date, he has 10 years of experience.  His wife supports him in the business.

He is organizing a communal bank to request a loan that he will use to buy fertilizers.  This way, he can fertilize 15 cuerdas (around 3.5 acres) of coffee plants.  In the future, he wants to have more land so that he could cultivate more crops to increase his earnings.  

The other members of this communal bank also work in agriculture.  In the photograph, 11 members appear, but only 8 of them were granted this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Chanra is 28 years old and married with two children. To support her family, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for eight years. Sometimes, she catches fish to earn extra income. From the current business, she can earn about 36,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Chanra’s group of four with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she is a client is her fourth loan cycle. The first loans have helped her better support her family. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Chanra is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ong's Group

texts.en:
Ong is aged 54 years. She is living with her children in a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She has nine children. Rice farming and rubber planting have been the main sources for her family’s income for almost 30 years. To supplement the income, she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 54,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and she manages to save about 33,000 KHR each day for their future needs.
 
Ong has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles, and she successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is confident to make a better living. Requesting a loan with VisionFund, Ong, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on buying more rubber trees for planting. She hopes to grow her rice and rubber healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s lifestyle and build on her savings to extend her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is widowed with five children. Socorro is 66 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines.

Socorro is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional seedlings for her flower business.

Socorro has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Socorro hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings for her flower business.

loans.name: Hursand

texts.ru: Хурсанд, соответствуя значению своего имени – всегда улыбчивая, доброжелательная и добрая. Хурсанд швея. Она шьёт прекрасные национальные платья для женщин. Также Хурсанд умело вышивает на платье различные узоры из бисера, бус, создаёт декоративные цветы из них и украшает ими платья. У нее определенное количество клиентов, которых Хурсанд всегда рада обслужить. В основном она шьет дома. Хурсанд превратила одну комнату в маленькую мастерскую, это её мир искусства, где она создает прекрасные платья и этим предает тканям жизнь. Кроме таланта она имеет любящих детей. Её дети уже взрослые. Старший ее сын уехал в Россию на заработки и ежемесячно высылает деньги семье. Теперь Хурсанд несёт ответственность не только за свою семью, но и за семью сына. Как заботливая мама и бабушка она имеет огромное желание видеть детей счастливым и делает много усилий для этого. Хурсанд хочет отремонтировать свой дом, где живёт её большая семья. Но денежных средств, которые она имеет от совего бизнеса не достаточно, чтобы отремонтировать свой дом. Поэтому Хурсанд обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки строительных материалов, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Она надеться на поддержку со стороны Арванд и «Кива» и заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en:
Hursand, as the meaning of her name implies, is always smiling, kind and friendly.  She works as a seamstress.  She sews beautiful traditional Tajik dresses for women.  She is also a skilled embroiderer and she creates various patterns with beads, making decorative flower patterns to embellish her dresses.  She has a certain number of customers, whom she is always happy to serve.  She mainly sews at home, having transformed a small room into a studio which has become her world of art and where she creates beautiful dresses, giving life to her fabrics.

In addition to her talent as a seamstress, Hursand is a loving mother.  Her children are already grown-ups.  Her oldest son left for Russia to make a living and sends money home every month.  Hursand is now responsible not only for her own family, but also for her son's family.  As a caring mother and grandmother, her strongest desire is to see her children happy and she does everything to make this happen.

Hursand wants to repair the house where her large family lives.  However, the money that she makes thanks to her sewing business is not sufficient to perform home repairs.  This is the reason why she has turned to MDO Arvand, requesting a loan to buy building materials for the renovation of her house.  She hopes to receive some support from MDO Arvand and Kiva, and she thanks her lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere agregar el rubro de venta de mariscos, ya que se lo administrara su cuñado, además adquirir algunas herramientas para la albañilería; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar pescado, camarón, conchas; también una cuchara para trabajar en construcción.
El crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro completar la comprar de  un vehículo  y algunos repuestos. Su deseo es construir otra vivienda propia y brindarle ayuda a  su familia; también crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Julio currently needs a new loan because he needs to expand his seafood sales now that his brother in law will also be assisting with the business. Julio will also be acquiring some tools for masonry work. This investment will help him purchase fish, shrimp, and shellfish, as well as a trowel for working in construction. 

The previous loan was successful: he was able to purchase a vehicle and some spare parts. His goal is to build another home for himself and provide for his family, while continuing to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase fish, shrimp, and shellfish; as well a trowel for working in construction.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун позитивный и жизнерадостный мужчина. Он успешный предприниматель, живёт в сельской местности и занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота в своём посёлке. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Как его соседи говорят, Турсун является человеком успешным, добросовестным, честным и целеустремленным. Турсун очень много работает, чтобы иметь постоянный доход для своей семьи. Поэтому он ведёт свой собственный бизнес. Одновременно  он даже ведёт два бизнеса. Поначалу он начинал с малого дела, он откармливал скот а потом их продавал. Сейчас он расширил настолько свой бизнес, что он уже выращивает крупный рогатый скот. Доход от этого бизнеса очень хороший. Но потом пришла идея выращивать сельхоз культуру, так он мог экономить расходы на откорм скота, используя свою выращенную сельхоз культуру. Но сейчас Турсун получил много урожая и имеет большое количество корма для крупного скота. Поэтому ему сейчас необходимо увеличить поголовье своего скота. Для этого Турсун обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота. Это поможет ему расширить свой бизнес и увеличить доход его семьи. Турсун заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Tursun is a positive and good-humored man. He is a successful entrepreneur, lives in a rural region and works fattening cattle in his village. He is married and has three children. 

As his neighbors say, Tursun is successful, conscientious, honest, and dedicated. Tursun works a lot to provide consistent income for his family. For that reason, he runs his own business. Actually, he runs two businesses simultaneously. At first, he started with a small business fattening and reselling cattle. Now, he has grown his business so much that he raises his own cattle. Income from his business has been good, but he got the idea to grow his own crops to reduce spending by feeding this cattle home-grown feed.

By now, Tursun has a large harvest and a large amount of feed for cattle. Because of this, it is now necessary to increase the number of cattle. For this, Tursun applied for a loan from Arvand to buy a few additional cattle. The loan will help him grow his business and increase his family's income. Tursun is grateful to Arvand for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 23 years old and single. He belongs to the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank, and their main economic activities are agriculture, transportation services and livestock. He needs this loan to buy more animals, such as bulls and cows. His dream is to buy a car. He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his payments punctually. He was born in the community of Jajahuana and lives in the same community where he was born. (The Jajahuana community is located in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Perú).

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as bulls and cows, for his livestock business.

loans.name: Brayan Alberto

texts.en: At 18 years old, Brayan is a typical young man - he loves soccer, his family, and local cuisine. His favorite food is ceviche, the world-renowned Peruvian marinated fish dish. Brayan has not completed high school and spends his days working as a laborer in the fields, along with his brother. His lifelong dream is to study agronomy, and he knows that, with hard work and dedication, he can achieve his goal. With the help of Kiva lenders, Brayan will use his loan to buy a motorbike, which will allow him to get to work early and earn extra income. With the extra income, he will be able to better support his family and, little by little, to improve the quality of their lives. Brayan is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and knows that his loan will be put to good use, since he always strives to work hard and be responsible.

loans.use: to pay for a motorbike so he can get to work early and earn more income.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en: Carlos is a dedicated 31-year-old father who works for a livestock business in his hometown, Imperial. He lives with his 3-year-old son and his partner. Every day, Carlos wakes up motivated and excited to grow both personally and professionally. His committed work ethic is a result of the values instilled in him by his mother. Due to his strong desire to improve his family’s quality of life, Carlos plans to use this loan to buy a secondhand mototaxi that he will subsequently rent to others in order to increase his income. He is extremely grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity and wants them to know that their help will allow him to continue to move forward and help him one day to achieve his lifelong goal of completing his degree in auto mechanics.

loans.use: to buy second-hand mototaxi in order to start a rental business.

loans.name: Jimy Alvaro

texts.en: Jimy is a jovial young 20-year-old who works as a customer service representative. Jimy recently completed technical school, and he hopes to start studying for a degree in accounting.
