When Jimy is not working, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends, after which he relaxes with a plate of his favorite food - "seco de res con frijoles" (a Peruvian dish of beef and beans). Jimy is taking out this loan because he wants to improve the quality of his home life. He plans to buy a bed and a wardrobe for his clothes. Thanks to the generosity of Kiva lenders, Jimy will be able to live more comfortably as he begins his studies, striving to one day become a very successful professional.

loans.use: to pay for a bed and a wardrobe for his home.

loans.name: Katherin Jenyfer

texts.en: Katherin is a 24-year-old single woman who works daily as a cashier at a local bank. She always strives to work hard and to live as a responsible and efficient young professional. It is for these reasons that she knows she will be successful with the funds lent to her by Kiva lenders. With this loan, Katherin will help cover some of the costs of constructing a home for her mother. Katherin expects that this will greatly improve her family’s quality of life. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity and wants them to know that their support motivates her to keep moving forward and to continue to work toward achieving her main goal: to move up the ladder in her professional career.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs to build a home for her mother.

loans.name: Luis Giomar

texts.en: Luis is a dedicated 26-year-old construction assistant who lives with his family in his hometown, Imperial. The strong work ethic that Luis exhibits is a result of the values instilled in him by his grandparents. Being the family man that he is, Luis will use this loan to repair the floor in his family's living room. It has deteriorated over the years, and he wants to repair it to allow his family and visitors to have a better and more comfortable experience. Since Luis always strives to work hard, he knows that this loan will be put to good use in improving the quality of his family's life. In the future, Luis would like to study machinery and increase his income to better support his family. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.

loans.use: to repair the floor in his family's living room.

loans.name: Nay Ruth

texts.en: Nay is a 24-year-old schoolteacher whose lifelong goal is to earn an advanced degree in teaching. She always strives to provide her students with a better education and to be a great role model in their lives. Nay is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and encouragement. With her loan, she will make improvements to her home, including fixing the front door and windows. Her home is made of old materials and has begun to deteriorate. These home improvements will improve the quality of her home life and make any guests feel more comfortable and have an enjoyable experience. As Nay continues her studies, she hopes that her income will increase and the overall quality of her life will improve.

loans.use: to pay for construction to improve to her house.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is married and a 44-year-old mother of five. She lives in Audora, Zamboanga Del Sur, with her family. Her husband is a government employee. She operates a hog-raising business. She has been doing this for many years, to earn income in addition to her husband’s salary. She took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy livestock feed. She hopes to improve and expand her business to generate more revenue for the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Rejane

texts.en: Rejane is married, a 23-year-old mother who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Her husband is a businessman. She helps in their business of buying and selling crabs. For two years they have earned PHP 6,500  a month. She took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more crabs and shrimps to sell. She is thankful to GDMPC because being a member helps to improve their quality of life and their ability to engage in business. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and shrimps to sell.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en: Melchor is married and has three children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, with his family. His wife is a businesswoman, while Melchor operates a motor rental business to make a living. He has been doing this for many years, and he earns PHP 5,500 a month. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and is now applying for a loan of PHP 33,000  to pay for the costs of motor repairs and maintenance. He plans to acquire another motorcycle unit, for expansion.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of motor repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Marlith Liliana

texts.es:
Marlith tieen 36 años de edad,  y desde hace algunos años, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de juguetes, Marltih inicio su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo luego de mucho ahorro; Marltih labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con los ingresos de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Marlith está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas juguetes al por mayor, con lo cual podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Marlith is 36 years old, and for several years now she has run a small business selling toys. She started her business after a lot of hard work and a lot of time spent saving her money. Marlith works about nine hours a day, and with the income from her work she has been able to meet her household expenses.

Marlith is very grateful for the support that she has gotten through Kiva microloans. Thanks to the loans, she is able to buy more of her toys wholesale, which increases her income and helps her keep fighting toward her greater dream: having her own home.

loans.use: purchase toys at wholesale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina runs her sari-sari store (general store) in the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer, which provides their main source of income. Marcelina successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she been used as additional capital in her business. She took out a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar and soft drinks. She is thankful to GDMPC  because it gives her an opportunity to improve her business. She plans to save the revenue she generates for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles sugar and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Muya

texts.en:
Muya is 40 years old. She is married and has two children aged 20 and 18. In 2002, she started a business in cow's milk sales. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

Muya has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young dairy cow. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.
On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 litres of milk each day. In the local market, a litre of milk sells for about USD $0.40. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

In the future, Muya plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Meda

texts.en: Marcelina runs her sari-sari store (general store) in the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer, which provides their main source of income. Marcelina successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she been used as additional capital in her business. She took out a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar and soft drinks. She is thankful to GDMPC  because it gives her an opportunity to improve her business. She plans to save the revenue she generates for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nemfa

texts.en: In a village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, ZDS, Philippines, Nemfa runs a general store to make a living. Her husband earns an income through fishing, which provides their main source of income. She is 46 years old and has four children. Her determination to send her children to school is the reason she tries so hard. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008 and has successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used to improve her business. She recently took out a new loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional goods, such as feed, rice, oil and kerosene, to sell. She is hopeful that this will permit her to generate more income and bring success to the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her store, such as feed, rice, oil and kerosene.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is widow with four children who runs her own flower garden in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, to make a living. She has been doing this for years. The flowers are delivered to the flower shop in town. She took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more varieties of flower seedlings and fertilizer, such as manure, to improve her garden and bring in an abundant harvest. She is hopeful that, with this line of business, she can cover the needs of her children and able to send them to school.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of flower seedlings and fertilizer, such as manure, for her business.

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Bou is 40 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice, as well as working for others for pay. The current business earns her family about 22,000 KHR per day, to meet her family’s needs. Bou just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm, and she will also use part to hire labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business, so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vouch

texts.en: Originally from a rural village in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Vouch is a 30-year-old married man. Rice farming has been the main source of his family’s income for two years. To better support the family and help to earn more income, his wife works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 19,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs, and they manage to save about 13,000 KHR each day for their future needs. This is Vouch’s first microloan from VisionFund. He is applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow his rice more fruitfully and healthily, and thus to make more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo is studying at the Western Mindanao State University in Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is 18 years old lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with his family. His father is a teacher in their town while his mother is a businesswoman. 

Leonilo wants to continue his education, so he borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to pay the tuition fees for the first semester of this current year. He is hopeful to get a job after finishing his studies to support himself, as well as his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en: A citizen from a rural village in Battambang province’s Sangke district, Sambath is 20 years old, married, and has one son. To make a living and support her family, Sambath and her husband have been tailoring clothes and working as a taxi-driver. They can earn about 37,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. This is Sambath’s first microloan from VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy a sewing machine and another portion to buy spare parts to repair their car. She hopes to earn more income from the current businesses so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Roey's Group

texts.en: Roey is 53 years old, a widow with four children living in a rural village in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. She earns a living by farming rice and selling grocery items, as she has done for 10 years. The current business earns her about 9,000 KHR per day, and she manages her to save about 3,000 KHR each day for future needs. Roey has been with VisionFund for six cycles. Roey successfully used the past loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business, in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en: Apolinaria is a widow with nine children. Apolinaria is 63 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Apolinaria sells a variety of snacks to earn a living, and she has had this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan to buy flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients. Apolinaria has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Apolinaria hopes to have more savings to add to her capital.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients for her snack food business.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch, 41, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one son, who is still in school. For the past 10 years, Touch and her husband have been farming rice on a one-hectare farm as main source of the family’s income. Together, they can earn about 37,000 KHR per day from the current business. Touch has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid her past loans. The loans she successfully repaid have helped her support her family, with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Touch will use her portion of her loan to buy piglets to raise, in order to earn extra income. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, aged 42, is a married mother of four children. She lives in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Out of her children, one is dependent on her and still in school. Vorn is a farmer, who grows rice and cassava. She has been in the business for twenty-three years, and she can earn about 17,000KHR per day and can save about 7,000KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Vorn with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to enrich her farmland, so as to increase her rice production and her family’s income. She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nora Xiomara

texts.es:
Nora es una joven de 29 años de edad emprendedora, luchadora madre soltera de dos hijos los cuales el mayor de 7 años el cual está en primaria y el segundo de cuatro años. Con ella vive un hermano y un cuñado y en familia se dedican a la agricultura siendo su negocio y medio de ingresos el café ya que desde muy pequeña trabaja la tierra ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra elaborando actividades como, limpieza, abono, corte, etc. Sus cultivos de café están cultivados a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada a pie diaria mente. Nora solo pudo cursar hasta el quinto año de primaria  ya que no tuvo apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres siendo ellos de escasos recursos. Sus sueños son seguir estudiando para poderse graduar y autor realizar en una parte de su vida, educar sus 2 hijos para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que obtenga un nivel educativo universitario y poder ampliar sus cultivos de café para lograr obtener mejores ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y de sus hijos. 

Nora actualmente solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de: 4 bolsas de nutrí café, 4 bolsas de abono 18-46-0, 4 bolsas de urea, 3 bolsa de abono foliar y un litro de ALTO 10 SL para dar mantenimiento y protección a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Nora is an enterprising and hard-working young woman of 29. She is a single mother of two children, who are four and seven years old. Her oldest child is in primary school. Also living with Nora are her brother and brother-in-law. She comes from an agricultural family, and her business and source of income is coffee. Ever since she was little, she has worked the land. It was her parents who taught her this work, how to clean and fertilize fields, and how to harvest crops. 

Her coffee crops are located two kilometers from her home, a distance she travels on foot every day. Nora was only able to complete five years of primary school because she lacked the necessary financial support, given that her parents had limited resources.

Her dreams are to continue studying so that she can graduate and achieve that goal for herself, to educate her two children so that they have a better quality of life and attain a university-level education, and to expand her coffee crop in order to obtain greater profits for the wellbeing of her family and her children. 

Nora is seeking a loan now from the COMIXMUL cooperative for the purchase of four bags of nutrí café, four bags of 18-46-0 fertilizer, four bags of urea, 3 bags of foliar fertilizer, and one liter of ALTO-10SL (Cyproconazole fungicide) in order to maintain and protect her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita treasures her eight years of being a member of PMPC. She is 66 years old, married, and has four children.

Rosalita sells a variety of products at her general store to earn a living. She has had this business for 10 years, in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this work.

She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900. She will use it to purchase additional products to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, and soap. In the future, Rosalita hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, and soap.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband is a labourer and she helps to generate income by running a resale business to make a living. 

For ten years with her business, Maribeth has been earning at least 8,000 PHP a month from the sale of products such as softener, shampoo and beauty soap. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used for the business. She took out a new loan recently to purchase additional beauty products, detergent and bath soap for resale. She hopes to see her children succeed in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products, detergent and bath soap for resale

loans.name: Edilito

texts.en:
Edilito is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two young children. Edilito has been in the fishing business for more than three years now. This is the source of his income.

Edilito is asking for a loan to be used in acquiring a new fishing boat. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

Edilito hopes of expanding his fishing venture, so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, like food, and to pay the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Kori Ampara Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY AMPARA II”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, costura de deportivos, tejido de chompas, venta de golosinas, costura de mantas, tejido de tapetes, tienda de barrio, elaboración de bancos de madera, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que es el octavo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de joyas; da a conocer que esta actividad la aprendieron sus hijos y con el pasar del tiempo ella decidió dedicarse a la venta de este producto para apoyar a la venta a sus hijos sin embargo con el pasar del tiempo ella aprendió este oficio y decidió hacer su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material de joyería) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la orientación de las asesoras de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "KORY AMPARA II" will start its third term with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office. It is composed of ten members and is run by a board of directors with Ms. Rosmery as the president. The members run a wide variety of businesses, including the sewing of sportswear and blankets; the sales of clothing, candy, and foods; the weaving of sweaters and tablecloths; the crafting of wood benches, and even a neighborhood corner shop.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit the small businesses in Rosmery's group. She said that this is their eighth term as part of Pro Mujer, and that they joined at the invitation of a Pro Mujer promoter who came to visit her at her house. Currently, she runs a business selling jewelry. She told us that her children learned jewelry making, and at first, she began to sell these products to support her children's sales, but as she learned more over time, she decided to launch her own independent business.

This loan will be used to increase her capital by purchasing additional material for jewelry, which she will get from the wholesale markets in the city of El Alto. She will then make the jewelry and sell it in her sales space. This work allows her to generate income for her family as she is single and has two children.

When asked what she liked best about Pro Mujer, she said she liked the orientation provided by the credit counselors.

loans.use: purchase jewelry-making materials.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Cajata Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENA ESPERANZA CAJATA PAMPA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de ganado, venta de frutas, venta de comida, venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de detergentes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa de su padre quien le prestó un pequeño capital para el inicio de su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de detergentes) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Buena Esperanza Cajata Pampa" will begin its first term in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional office. It is comprised of eight members, and is run by a board of directors with Ms. Carmen as the president. The members run a wide variety of businesses, including the sales of vegetables, weaving of sweaters and blankets, sales of cattle, fruits, other foods, and detergents.

This loan will benefit the group of small businesses where Carmen is a member. She said that this was their first loan with Pro Mujer and that they joined at the invitation of a Pro Mujer promoter who came to visit her at her house. Currently, she runs a business selling detergents. She learned the business from her father, who loaned her a small amount of capital to start up the business.

This current loan will be used to increase her capital through the purchase of detergents, which she will get from the stores in the city of El Alto, and then sell in her sales location. This work allows her to earn money towards maintaining her home, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training that she gets about credit and health.

loans.use: purchase detergent for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine and stock (pens, notebooks, cardboard, and markers, among others).

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia, a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, is married, with two children. Her husband is a farmer and she helps with the earning by operating a garden to make a living.  

In 2011, Venancia joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and it helps them to improve their quality of living. She successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for their farm. She borrowed a new loan to finance the costs of land preparation and fertilization for her garden plot. 

Venancia was determined to improve their living and, with this belief, she never gets tired of working on their farm.

loans.use: to finance the costs of land preparation and fertilization.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 34 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 12.  In 2005, she established her grocery store. She works seven days a week and twelve hours a day to support her family.

Kamala has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called 'pasal', are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking at home.

Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing larger quantities, the owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen. 

In the future, Kamala plans to improve the economic conditons of her family.  She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy grocery products for resale

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa is 26 years old. She is married and has one child aged 5.

In 2008 she established her goat raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW. In the future, Rupa plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

She established her goat raising business five years ago to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy baby goats for her business.

loans.use: to buy baby goats

loans.name: Chiquita

texts.en:
Chiquita is married with 3 children. Chiquita is 68 years old and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Chiquita has a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to pay for assorted biscuits and candies, sacks of sugar and gallons of cooking oil.

Chiquita has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, Chiquita hopes to have more savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for assorted biscuits and candies, sacks of sugar and gallons of cooking oil

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is married, with one child. Maria is 51 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Maria is a farmer and operates her piggery business to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for her piggery. 

In the future, Maria hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con su familia, su esposa de 39 años de edad y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 10 y 29 años. El, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas, tales como maíz y plátano, asimismo realiza el oficio de albañil, todos los días sale a buscar el pan de cada día.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a obtener cosechas favorables y ganancias.
Su sueño es que su hijo de 10 años termine el bachillerato en su momento y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his family. His wife is 39 and his 2 children are 10 and 29. He sows basic grains and vegetables, like corn and plantain, but also works as a bricklayer. Everyday he goes out to earn the bread of every day. 
The loan he's requesting will allow him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies, like manure, weed killer, pesticide and insecticide, among other items. This investment will help him obtain favorable crops and earnings. 
His dream is for his son to finish high school when it's time and to be able to provide him a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy manure, weed killer, pesticide and insecticide, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is a 56-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs an elei fabric printing business in her community. She has 5 years of experience with this business.

Epenesa has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric paints and an overlock machine. She plans to use her profits to financially support her family. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric paints and an overlock machine

loans.name: El Renacer Group

texts.es:
La socia Reyna pertenece al banco comunal EL RENACER, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica al cuidado de ancianos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de gallinas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Reyna belongs to the EL RENACER communcal bank in the province of Cusco.

Reyna is 31-years-old, the mother of four children, and lives with her partner. She divides her days between a business and a job. She raises small animals, such as chickens, and also works caring for elderly people. Reyna has raised animals for some time and thanks to her day-to-day efforts, business is strong. 

Reyna is a very responsible and hard-working person, and hopes to continue working at the combination of her business and her elder-care job so she'll be able to keep supporting her family. She is applying for a loan to purchase chickens for her business. She is grateful for the loan and is determined to meet her payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for her business.

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en:
Potoae is a 24-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.

Potoae needs a loan to buy a deep freezer, foam cups, sugar, cordial and Chinese lollies. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Potoae has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy deep freezer, foam cups, sugar, cordial and Chinese lollies

loans.name: Deyvi De Los Santos

texts.es: Deyvi es padre de una hija, por quien trabaja a diario para que tenga un buen porvenir en la vida, se desempeña en una gasolinera como supervisor de bombas de combustible, su mayor deseo es que con sus ingresos ir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda poco a poco. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales como cerámica y cemento para ponerle cerámica al piso de su casa, esto le garantiza que su hija crezca en un ambiente sano y limpio.
texts.en:
Deyvi is the father of one daughter. For this reason, he works every day so that she can have a good future in life. Deyvi is employed at a gas station where he works as a fuel tank supervisor. His greatest wish is to use his earnings to improve the conditions at home a little bit at a time.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials, such as ceramic tiles and cement for installing a floor in his house. This will ensure that his daughter can grow up in a clean and healthy environment.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles and cement for installing a floor.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karla Alexandra ella es soltera y tiene 25 años y tiene 1 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia hace trabajos de aretes, collares y pulseras y lo vende en forma independiente las diferentes personas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene en este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, en sus tiempos libre a la socia le gusta salir con sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de aretes, pulseras y collares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para hacer los collares, pulseras y aretes como hilos y piedras.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de vidrios.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These ladies are members of the “NUEVO AMANECER” communal bank, located in the Cisco district, province and department.

Karla Alexandra is 25 years old, single and has 1 child. She makes and sells arts and crafts, like earrings, necklaces and bracelets. She sells her crafts independently to different people. She works from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm, and has been doing this for 5 years. Things are going well for her and she enjoys going out with her children in her spare time. Her goal is to expand her business. She is requesting the loan to buy materials to make the earrings, necklaces and bracelets, like thread and gemstones.

The other members sell fruit, clothing, grocery items and glass. 

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: buy materials to make the earrings, necklaces and bracelets, like thread and gemstones.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 36 years old and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 5 children. To earn a living, Judith has a business selling a variety of dried fish. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Judith has requested a loan to purchase a variety of dried fish.

Judith is just newly a member of PMPC.  In the future, Judith would like to have success in her business and hopes to build their own house.

loans.use: to pay for variety of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.es:
Rosa, vive solamente con su esposo de 29 años de edad, trabajan individualmente. Ella, posee una tienda y también se dedica a la venta, elaboración de pupusas y tortillas, dicha actividad de las pupusas la realiza por las mañanas mientras que lo otro por las mediodías, lo cual lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar mercadería, tales como: frijoles, maíz, queso, azúcar, arroz, papel higiénico, entre otros productos. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. 
El sueño de la Sra. Rosa es tener su propia casa; respecto a su negocio desea crecer y obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband, who is 29 years old. They work by themselves. She has a shop and also sells and makes pupusas and tortillas. She makes the pupusas in the morning, while she makes the tortillas at mid-day. She does this every day.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy merchandise, such as beans, corn, cheese, sugar, rice, and toilet paper, among other products. This investment will help her to strengthen her business and obtain better profits.

Rosa's dream is to have her own house; with respect to her business, she wants to grow and obtain greater profits.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, cheese, sugar, rice, and toilet paper, among other products

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 58 años de edad, casada y madre de 7 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 20 años. Empezó  en esta actividad vendiendo cajeta de manera ambulante, gracias a su esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación estableció su pulpería. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso el alquiler de una casa. Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos tales como: Arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pasta dental, papel higiénico, jabón, golosinas, entre otros con el fin de surtir su pulpería. Su plan futuro es  expandir su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Adela is originally from the city of Boaco. She is 58 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Adela is a merchant by trade and has been managing a store for 20 years. She started her business by selling caramel as a street vendor. Thanks to her effort, work, and dedication, she was able to establish a store. She also earns additional income by renting out a house.

Adela is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, toothpaste, toilet paper, soap, snacks, and other products to restock her store. Her future plans include expanding her business and increasing her earnings. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, toothpaste, toilet paper, soap, snacks, and other products.

loans.name: Ana Rafaela

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su familia, su esposo de 27 años de edad y su hijo de un año de edad. Ella, se dedica a la crianza de pollos y venta de tamales, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días junto y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar materia prima, tales como: maíz, cal, ollas, verduras, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su negocio, al fortalecimiento del mismo y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su aspiración es pagar dicho crédito y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her family, her husband, who is 27, and her son, who is one year old. She raises chickens and sells tamales. She does this every day alongside and with the help of her life partner.

The loan she needs will allow her to buy raw materials, such as corn, lime, pots, and vegetables, among other items. This investment will help her to improve her business, to strengthen it, and to obtain greater profits.

Her goal is to pay the loan and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, pots, and vegetables, among other items

loans.name: Suhbat

texts.en:
Suhbat is 17 years old and lives with his mother, two older sisters, and brother in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His mother works at a local company as an accountant. His oldest sister has graduated from university and works at a local broadcasting channel. Another sister studies at university and his brother attends a local secondary school. 

Suhbat was very interested in math as a kid and has chosen economics as his university major. He said, "I want to graduate as early as possible to start working and helping my mother and siblings." He is now requesting 370,000MNT to pay his tuition fee for fall semester 2013. He is a passionate, hardworking, and smart young man.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for fall semester 2013

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con su familia, ya está casada y su esposo tiene 53 años de edad, sus hijos de 15 y 17 años. Ella, se dedica a la venta de frutas  y verduras, lo cual lo realiza por la mañana  también venta de ropa americana, esta lo desempeña por las tardes, dichas actividades las lleva a cabo todos los días.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar mercadería, tales como: manzanas, uvas, naranjas, plátanos, yuca, pipián, tomates y ropa, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien en la universidad y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her family. She is married and her husband is 53 years old. Her children are 15 and 17. Teresa sells fruits and vegetables in the morning, but she also sells American clothes in the afternoon. She conducts both of her businesses every day.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy merchandise such as apples, grapes, oranges, bananas, cassava, pumpkins, tomatoes, as well as clothes and other items. This investment will help strengthen her business so that she can generate more income. Her dreams are to see her children study at the university and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, oranges, bananas, cassava, pumpkins, tomatoes, as well as clothes and other items.

loans.name: Amaamaula

texts.en: Amaamaula is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a business venture of elei printing. She has 3 years of experience in this line of business. Amaamaula needs a loan to buy materials, fabric paints, brushes, stencils and wooden carved designs. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and help her family members. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric paints, brushes, stencils and wooden carved designs for her elei printing business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is married with six children and lives in Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay with her family. Her husband is a farmer, which is their main source of income, while Trinidad has operated her sawali making business for many years. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2009 and successfully repaid her previous loans that she used for the business. She borrowed a loan recently to buy more raw materials like bamboo. She is thankful to GDMPC for their trust that leads to improving her quality of life. She hopes to send her children to school to give them a better future.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for manufacturing 'sawali' (mats).

loans.name: Maria Yaneth

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad de pago que la Institución brinda y por las ganancias obtenidas; esta inversión le servirá para comprar materia prima, tales como: maíz, cal, gas, aceite, elotes, azúcar, entre otros.
Cuenta la Sra. María que el crédito anterior le ayudo a salir adelante con sus deudas y lo cual ha sido de mucha oportunidad para que el negocio crezca. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
María needs to opt for a new loan because of the ease of payment the institution provides and because of the profit obtained; this investment will be useful to her for buying raw materials, such as corn, lime, gas, oil, sweet corn, and sugar, among other items.

María says that the previous loan helped her to move forward with her debts and has been a great opportunity for the business to grow. The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, gas, oil, sweet corn, and sugar, among other items

loans.name: Greysi Lilibeth

texts.es:
Greysi es una joven de 25 años.  Cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en la actividad que realiza, que es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, tiene un grado académico de educación media culminada, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en un taller de mecánica, tienen 2 hijos en las edades de 5 y un año de edad, los cuales por el momento no están estudiando y los que dependen de ellos. 

Ella es propietaria de una  venta de tortillas, actividad que aprendió de su mamá. Se decidió en emprender el negocio al verse en la necesidad de subsistir y darles estudios a sus hijos, el negocio lo tiene en su casa,  por lo que no cancela lo que son impuestos y junto con su compañero de vida, piensan en incrementar sus ganancias.

El préstamo lo esta solicitando, para comprar maíz y tener en reserva, ya que la cliente compra por libras y comprando al mayoreo obtiene más ganancia.  Además de eso, comprara leña y otros insumos que necesita para incrementar el negocio. Por ende, al incrementar sus ganancias mejora su calidad de vida ya que pueden obtener una mejor vivienda.

Está decidida en hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco le invertirá para ser mejor siempre que su competencia, a futuro ella espera que sus hijos puedan obtener un título de técnico como mínimo, y construir una vivienda digna ya que ella no cuenta con los suficientes recursos económicos,  ha tomado a bien disponer de  la ayuda de Fundación Campo para ampliar su negocio y así contratar ayudantes para  cubrir la demanda.
texts.en: Greysi is 25 years old.  She has five years of experience in her line of work, which is making and selling tortillas.  She has partially completed her education.  She lives in a common-law relationship, and her partner works in an automotive repair shop.  They have 2 dependant children who are aged 5 and one, and who are not yet in school.  She owns a business that sells tortillas, which is an activity that she learned from her mother.  She decided to start her business out of a need to support and educate her children.  She works out of her home so that she does not pay taxes, and together with her life partner she is thinking about increasing her income.  The loan that she is requesting is to buy corn and have a reserve supply, because it is bought by the pound, and by buying wholesale she can improve her earnings.  In addition to this she will buy firewood and other supplies that she needs to expand her business.  She hopes that this will result in better earnings and an improvement in her quality of life, as she can acquire better housing.   She has decided to grow her business little by little by investing in it to improve it.  In the future she hopes that her children will obtain at least a technical diploma, and that she can build an adequate home, since she does not have sufficient financial resources.  She has taken advantage of the help from the Fundacion Campo to expand her business and in doing so to hire assistants to meet the demand.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and other supplies that she needs to expand her business.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia is married with five children. She is 72 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Crescencia sells a variety of snacks to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Crescencia has been a member of PMPC for 10  years. In the future, Crescencia hopes to have more savings for additional capital for future needs.

loans.use: to pay for flour, milk, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is married with two children. She is 62 years old and lives in Catarman, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Jessie has a motorcycle for transportation  to earn a living. She has been doing this for five  years. She has requested a loan to pay for her motorcycle license and maintenance.

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Jessie hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle license and maintenance.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 25 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 5.  In 2010, she established her poultry business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day in that business, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW. She used her previous loan to buy small chickens.  In the future, Kamala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, feed, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Tibo Cosme

texts.fr: Tibo Cosme âgé de 33 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Élisabeth. Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En dehors de leur propre enfant, le couple à un autre enfant à sa charge. Tibo Cosme vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Tibo Cosme a très peu  fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture. Activité qu'il exerce dans son atelier depuis douze ans ; ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Tibo Cosme sollicite pour la cinquième  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Tibo Cosme, 33 years old, est married to a merchant named Élisabeth. The couple have three children, some of them enrolled in school and all of them in their parents' care. Besides their own children, the couple has another child to care for.  Tibo Cosme lives with his wife and children. The couple jointly support the household. 

Tibo Cosme did not attend school for long, but he learned sewing, a business he has been pursuing  in his workshop for 12 years and which allows him to contribute to paying for the needs of his family. Wishing to satisfy the demand of his clientele,  Tibo Cosme is requesting a loan from  ALIDé for the fifth time. His prior loans were correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Fiaoo

texts.en:
Fiaoo is a 37-year-old, married woman, who has five children. She makes and sells pan cakes in her community, to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Fiaoo needs a loan to buy more ingredients and utensils for making pan cakes. The things she will buy include: kerosene oven, oil, sugar, flour, baking soda, big containers, frying pan, filter, basin and wooden spoon. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Fiaoo has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and utensils for making pan cakes

loans.name: Faaliliu

texts.en: Faaliliu is 33 years old and married, and she has three children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling barbeque in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a barbeque oven, big basins, boxes of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, tomato sauce, onions, foam plates, foil and gas. In the future, Faaliliu hopes to maintain and improve her business, in order to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy the things she needs to start a business making and selling barbequed foods, including a barbeque oven, meats and sauces.

loans.name: Fogaletea

texts.en:
Fogaletea is 73 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling selling fish in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Fogaletea has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, a fishing rod, hooks, and lines.

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Fogaletea will use her profit to help upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a fishing rod, hooks, and lines

loans.name: Anarosa

texts.en:
Anarosa is 21 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a business venture, elei (or Samoan designed outfits). She has many years of experience in this line of business. 

Anarosa needs a loan to buy materials, fabric paints, brushes, stencils and wooden carved designs. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric paints, brushes, stencils and wooden carved designs.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 63 years old and lives in Cebulin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children. 

Ester has a hog raising business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase feed for her pigs. 

Ester has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Ester hopes to have enough savings to acquire land with coconut trees for her family.

loans.use: to pay for feed.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a widow with six children; she is 61 years old and lives in Catarman, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Rosalinda sells a variety of snacks to earn a living; she has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. 

In the future, she hopes to increase her savings for additional capital.

loans.use: to pay for flour, milk, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with three children. Marilyn is 27 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Philippines.

Marilyn sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marilyn hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is a married woman and a mother of two young children. They live in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than five years now. This is the source of their income.

Giselle is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for the fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Giselle has hopes of making their fishing venture a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 63 años, está casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su último hijo en su casa propia. Mercedes es dueña de una tienda que está ubicada en su casa, vende todo tipo de productos comestibles y gaseosas de las mejores marcas y sabores, tiene muchos clientes ya que en su zona no hay más tiendas de este tipo además asegura que el trato que brinda a los clientes hace que se vayan contentos después de hacer sus compras. Lleva 25 años en este negocio y cuenta con la ayuda eventual de su esposo. Recuerda que cuando empezó con esta actividad no tenia muchos conocimientos de cómo llevar a cabo esta función, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora es una experta vendedora y muy querida entre sus clientes. Le agrada su trabajo por que está en contacto con la gente y así no se siente sola cuando su esposo e hijo salen a trabajar, además le genera buenos ingresos debido a las elevadas ventas que tiene a diario.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que esta recibiendo ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará algunos abarrotes de mayor consumo como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite leche, gaseosas, panes, embutidos y otros productos que ofrece en su tienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 63 years old, married and lives together with her husband and youngest child in their own home. Mercedes is the owner of a grocery store that is located in her house. She sells all kinds of food products and the most popular brands and flavors of soft drinks. She has lots of clients as there are no other stores of this type in her area. Also she makes sure she treats the customers well so they leave her business satisfied. 

Mercedes has run this business for 25 years and counts on the part-time help of her husband. She remembers that starting out in this business she had little idea of how to run the store, but learned with time. Now she is an expert salesperson and very well-liked by her customers. She likes her work as she can be in contact with people and not feel lonely when her husband and son are out working. Plus her business generates good income due to the high sales every day.

At this time Mercedes is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN with which she will buy basic groceries such as rice, sugar, eggs, oil, milk, soft drinks, breads, sausages, and other products to sell in her store. She is grateful for the financial support she is receiving as this allows her to move forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, eggs, oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ma.socorro

texts.en:
Ma.socorro is married with four children. She is 56 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Ma.socorro is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living; she has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional piglets and feed. Ma.socorro has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Iniega

texts.en:
Iniega is 61 years old and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
 
Iniega works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to pay for fishing materials and to repair the engine of their pumpboat. 

Iniega has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, Iniega hopes to have more savings to renovate their house.

loans.use: to pay for fishing materials and engine repair.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with five children. Marilyn is 46 years old and lives in Mitugas, Tudela, Philippines.

Marilyn is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Marilyn hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Putsakada's Group

texts.en:
Putsakada lives in a rural village of the Sangke district, in Battambang province. She is aged 55 years and a married mother of four children. All of her children are dependents and still in school. For the last thirty-four years, Putsakada has been working as a teacher, while her husband is a solider. The current job earns her about 27,000KHR per day, to support her family’s needs.
 
Putsakada has been a member of VisionFund for eleven loan cycles already. She completely paid back the previous loans. She has used the loans from VisionFund to better support her business and her family’s living conditions. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan funds to buy tables, chairs, and a whiteboard, for tutoring students at home. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current job, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a whiteboard, for tutoring students at home

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Rosario”  está conformada por 08 personas trabajadoras que buscan mejorar cada día con el único propósito de velar por el bienestar de su familia. Dora una de las integrantes es casada y tiene 02 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Ella  se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor la cual lo distribuye en un mercado. Se siente feliz pues a sus 39 ha podido cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el transporte de sus frutas.  Su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro y de esta manera poder transportar sus frutas. El grupo “El Rosario” agradecen el apoyo brindado pues hace posible su progreso. Dora   se encuentra en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca color negro.
texts.en: The communal bank "The Rosary" is made up of 8 hard-working people who are looking to improve each day with the one goal of struggling for their families' well-being.  Dora is one of the group members.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is still dependent.  She works selling fruit in bulk which she distributes at a market.  She feels happy since at her 39 years of age she has been able to accomplish some of her dreams like improving her home.  The loan that she requested will be used for transporting her fruit.  Her greatest desire is to purchase a car and in that way transport her fruit.  The group "The Rosary" is thankful for the support given which makes progress possible.  Dora can be seen in the back part of the photograph -- she is the third from the left and is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: To pay to transport fruit in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: La Sra. Amanda tiene 48 años tiene  5 hijos que se encuentran  en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en la localidad de Huarina,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Sra. Amanda utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, arroz y fideo al por mayor  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, la Sra. Amanda va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de insumos,  su deseo de Sra. Amanda es crecer en su negocio, es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Amanda is 48 years old and has five children who are school age.  She works selling food in a stall that is located in the town of Huarina.  This loan is her first with Kiva.  Amanda will use the loan to purchase food in bulk like potatoes, rice, and noodles for use in making foods. In that way she will increase her sales and grow her capital.  Her reason for requesting a loan is the lack of capital for buying products.  Amanda is going to use the income to continue buying quantities of foods. Her desire is to grow her business.  She is a hard-working person and feels happy and grateful for Kiva because of the support that they are offering through this credit.

loans.use: To purchase foods in bulk.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, has five children. The oldest child is 18, while the youngest is 5. Erlinda, who is married to a fisherman, has been selling fish for almost 10 years. She and her husband work hard to support the daily needs of their family.


Erlinda has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to buy materials needed to repair a fishing boat and purchase a fishing net to improve their catch and increase their income. She would like to expand her fishing business to support the education of  her children and provide good living conditions for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to repair a fishing boat  and purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material to fix his prosthesis.

loans.name: Jerish

texts.ru: Жериш 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 дочерей. У Жериш - средне-специальное образование, работает в местной школе-библиотекарем. Жериш в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жериш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, а также 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жериш обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 1 головы крупного рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Жериш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели.
texts.en: Jerish is 35 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising five daughters. Jerish has a vocational high school education and works in the local school as a librarian. To earn additional income for her family, Jerish raises livestock. She started 10 years ago by spending 15,000 som (KGS) to buy animals. Thanks to her tireless work she today owns two cows and 20 sheep and goats, and earns 5,000 som (KGS) per month in income. In order to further develop the business Jerish is asking the Microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 30,000 som (KGS) loan to expand her herd by buying a cow. She plans to invest income from the loan into further expanding her herd, and also plans to save money to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Eline

texts.en: Eline is 32 years old and married; she has four children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing. She has three years of experience in this line of business. Eline needs a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, fabric, thread, tape measure, scissors and needles. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, fabric, thread, tape measure, scissors and needles

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married and has one child. Jocelyn has a shop, where she sells cosmetic products. She has had this business for 10 years.

She has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase additional cosmetic products to sell, such as makeup, foundations, and lotions. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetic products to sell, such as makeup, foundations, and lotions

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and the father of four children. Jeremias has been in the fishing business for more than 16 years. This is the source of his income.

Jeremias is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy a new engine for the fishing boat. With the new engine, Jeremias will be able to improve his catch, and that will give him more fish to sell in the market. Furthermore, Jeremias wants to expand his business and to save money, so that he can continually support the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a member of PMPC for 8 years.  She lives in Duanguican, Tudela, Philippines.  She is 52 years old and married with 3 children.  Luciana is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 10 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.

In the future, Luciana hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is married with 4 children.  She is 34 years old and lives in Mitugas, Tudela, Philippines.  Rosana is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 6 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.

Rosana has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, she hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 50 años de edad, está casada con Antonio y junto a él tiene 03 hijos de 17, 15 y 10 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Isabel se dedica a la venta de comidas, para ello instala su puesto de venta en el frontis de su casa, desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la tarde. Lleva en este negocio 09 meses y trabaja sola. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hoga, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio ampliándolo con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará todos los ingredientes al por mayor, tales como arroz, aceites, papas y otros.
texts.en:
Isabel, 50 years old, is married to Antonio. She has three children with him, who are 17, 15 and 10 years old respectively, and she lives with them in her own house.

Isabel makes her living selling food, for which she sets up her stall in front of her house. From there, she attends her customers in a friendly, cordial fashion. She works every day until 6 p.m. 

She has had this business for nine month and works alone. She likes her business because it allows her to have an income, with which she can afford some household expenses. She has plans to continue with her business, upgrading with better chairs and tables to provide more comfort for her customers.

She is asking for a loan of S/. 1500 (1500 nuevo soles), and she is grateful for the financial support you are providing to continue with her business and advance her plans. Moreover, she promises to make her payments in a punctual fashion. 

With the amount asked for, she will buy all the wholesale ingredients, such as rice, oils, potatoes and others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oils, potatoes and others.

loans.name: Ranojon

texts.ru: Раножон родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина, так как с детства помогала своим родителям по хозяйству, а также на полевых работах. Раножону 42 года, она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж Раножон работает врачом в сельской местности. Со своим мужем она живёт хорошо, они всегда понимают друг друга. Также они стараются вместе работать, чтобы обеспечивать себя и своих детей всем необходимым. У них очень дружная, трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная  семья. И это поведение родителей служит примером детям. Чтобы помочь мужу зарабатывать деньги, она сама начала свой маленький бизнес, который постепенно расширяется. У Раножон маленький магазинчик возле своего дома, где она продаёт продукты питания. В сельской местности летом много работы, все с утра уходят на полевые работы и приходят к вечеру.  И поэтому расположение магазинчика для соседей Раножон очень удобно и все они довольны. Сейчас Раножон желает расширить свой бизнес, чтобы иметь больше дохода, она желает расширить ассортимент своего товара на прилавке. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит для покупки продуктов питания для дальнейшей продажи. Раножон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее выражает свою благодарность Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Ranojon was born and raised in a rural area. She is a very harworking woman, as she helped her parents around the house and in the fields since childhood. Ranojon is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a rural doctor. She gets along well with her husband - they understand each other. They try to work together to provide themselves and their children with all their needs. They have a very friendly, hardworking, and joyful family. The parents' actions provide an example for the children. 

To help her husband earn money, Ranojon began her own small business, which she is gradually expanding. She has a small store near her house, where she sells groceries. In rural areas there is a lot of work to do in the summer: everyone goes out to the fields in the morning and returns in the evening. The location of Ranojon's store is convenient for her neighbors, and they are happy with it. 

Ranojon would now like to expand her business to earn a larger income. She wants to expand the types of goods she has on the shelves. To do this she came to Arvand and would like a loan to buy groceries for future sale. Ranojon hopes for good results, and thanks you in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with 5 children.  She is 45 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.  Susan is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 10 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.

Susan has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Susan hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Taei

texts.en: Taei is 31 years old and married with 1 child.  She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community.  To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, dripping oil, sugar, baking powder, and a frying pan.  In the future, Taei hopes to help her family with everyday needs and wants.  She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her pancake business.

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en:
Idalyn, 36 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

She has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizer for her banana plants. Idalyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana plants

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is single with no children.  She is 38 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.  Lennie sells a variety of products to earn a living.  She has had this business for 2 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, and soaps.

Lennie has been a member of PMPC for 5 months.  In the future, Lennie hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Manulele

texts.en:
Manulele is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Manulele has requested a loan to buy taro roots, a shovel, fertilizer, barbed wire and a wheelbarrow.

She became a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Manulele hopes to earn more profit to improve her plantation and help her family's daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, a shovel, fertilizer, barbed wire and  a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married and has one, grown-up child. She lives in the village of Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, with her family. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a retail store. She has been doing this business for more than six years.

She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008. She has successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used to expand her business. Natividad requests a new loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional goods to sell at the store, including canned goods, coffee and milk. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell at the store, including canned goods, coffee and milk

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is married with four children.  She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her family.  Her husband is a part-time carpenter while Marites operates their own farm of rice, which is their main source of income.  She had joined Gata Daku MPC in 2011 and successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used for farm improvement.  Recently, she borrowed a loan of 20,000 PHP to cover the costs of land preparation, labor, and fertilization.  She hopes to generate an abundant harvest so that she may save a portion of her revenue for the education of her children in the future.
