Gustavo se motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará insumos al por mayor (madera, pintura, inmunizante para la madera), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y poder entregar oportunamente los encargos que tiene pendientes, esto le permitirá aumentar su clientela lo que conlleva al incremento de pedidos y por ende, de ingresos, para seguir solventando los gastos de su familia y avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es montar otro taller donde pueda ofrecer oportunidades de empleo, además de mejorar las condiciones de vida y la estabilidad económica para disfrutar en familia de un futuro más próspero.
texts.en:
Gustavo, age 48, is married and has four children.  He has lived in the Antioquia region for 25 years.  When he arrived he was one more victim of the forced displacement due to the violence that was present in his native city.  He arrived together with his wife and children looking for new opportunities to get ahead.  Therefore, he decided to start his own business, a cabinetmaking business where he makes furniture, bedroom sets, dining room furniture, and others.  He is taking advantage of the knowledge he acquired thanks to his family’s teachings.

This way he has gotten the needed income to get his family ahead and to bring home the daily bread.  He is a hard-working, enterprising, strong, and active man who struggles tirelessly every day of the week.  He does this in order to overcome all of the obstacles that come up, especially the unfair competition around him.  This directly affects his finances.

Gustavo is motivated to request the support of the loan to buy supplies wholesale (wood, paint, and wood treatment).  He will do this in order to give continuity to his business and to be able to deliver the orders that he has on time.  This will allow him to increase his clientele, which brings an increase in orders and then income.  

He will do this in order to continue paying the family expenses and to move towards fulfilling his main dream.  His dream is to set up another shop where he will be able to provide employment opportunities.  He also wants to improve his living conditions and have financial stability in order to enjoy a more prosperous future with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (wood, paint, and wood treatment).

loans.name: Segundo Norman

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos,el es una persona muy amable trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Segundo trabaja como agente de seguridad brindando servicios de vigilancia en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Segundo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso de concreto y reforzar la habitación de sus hijos, así pues Segundo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un profesional.
texts.en:
Segundo is a man of 22 years. He lives in the city of Imperial with his wife and two small children. He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and the need to work, he was not able to study the professional career of law as he wanted to. 

Through his own initiative, Segundo works as a security guard, offering vigilance to a business in his city. He works every day for about 10 hours. He thinks it is going well because of his dedication and good performance. 

Segundo is very thankful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to the support they provide, he will improve his home. He wants to put in a concrete floor and reinforce his children’s room. Segundo will continue working and making an effort to achieve his big goal of becoming a professional.

loans.use: improve his home

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi âgée de 38ans est revendeuse. Depuis 2012, elle revend des chaussures et bijoux dans sa boutique. Elle s'approvisionne généralement au Grand Marché et sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, madame Kayi espère introduire la vente des sacs dame et assurer le bien - être de sa mère.
texts.en: Kayi is 38 years old and is a reseller. Since 2012, she has been reselling shoes and jewelry in her boutique. She usually gets her supplies at the large market and is requesting her second loan to buy merchandise. For the future, Madam Kayi hopes to introduce the sale of women's handbags and to ensure the well-being of her mother.

loans.use: to buy shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lili Johanna

texts.es: Lili es una mujer de veintinueve (29) años de edad, que vive en el municipio de Malambo, pueblo ribereño, del departamento del Atlántico, a orillas del gran río de la Magdalena, principal arteria fluvial de Colombia. Malambo  deriva su nombre del cacique Pedro Malambo, quien a su vez lo toma del árbol muy abundante en el Caribe latinoamericano llamado euforbiácea croton malambo. En este municipio de nombre historico interesante, justamente reside con su conyugue y tres (3) hijos, una (1) niña de seis (6) años, otra de trece (13) y un (1) varón de once (11) años de edad. Su actividad de negocio es la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas y fritos como empanadas, buñuelos, perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas y otros alimentos. Compra su materia prima e insumos de contado, y vende de contado de lunes a domingo; los fritos en el horario de siete (7) a nueve (9) de la mañana, y las comidas rápidas de cinco (5) de la tarde a diez (10) de la noche. Hace diez (10) años inició su negocio, producto de los ahorros que fue acumulando como ayudante, donde aprendió esta actividad. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en el mantenimiento de su carro de perros, y en la compra de los insumos con que elabora sus productos alimenticios. Espera mejorar la imagen del negocio con esta inversión. Sus metas son: Abrir un local propio, y tener casa propia, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lili, 29, lives in the town of Malambo, located in the department of Atlántico on the banks of the great Magdalena River, the main river causeway in Colombia.  The territory of Malambo gets its name from the Mocaná Indians, who got their name from a tree that's abundant in the Caribbean, called "euforbiácea croton malambo," a tree that's abundant in the Caribbean. 

In this town with its historically interesting name, she lives with her husband and three children, a girl, 6, another girl, 13, and a boy, 11.  Her business is making and selling fast food and fried food such as empanadas, doughnuts, hot dogs, hamburgers, sausage with potatoes, and other food.  She pays cash for her ingredients and supplies, and sells in cash from Monday through Sunday, fried food 7-9 a.m. and fast food 5-10 p.m.  She started her business 10 years ago with money she saved when she worked as an assistant, where she learned this job.

This is her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll use it to maintain her hot dog cart and to buy the ingredients to make her food.  She hopes to improve the appearance of her business with this investment.

Her goals are to open her own store and to have her own house so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain her cart and to buy ingredients

loans.name: Liliana Estela

texts.es: Liliana es una mujer de treinta y ocho (38) años de edad, vive en el municipio de Malambo,  pueblo ribereño, del departamento del Atlántico, ubicado a orillas del gran río de la Magdalena, principal arteria fluvial de Colombia. Malambo deriva su nombre del cacique Pedro Malambo, quien a su vez lo toma del árbol muy abundante en el Caribe latinoamericano llamado euforbiácea croton malambo. En este municipio de nombre historico interesante, justamente reside Liliana, mujer cabeza de familia,  con su hijo de catorce (14) años de edad. Su actividad de negocio es la comercialización de blusas, jean, lápiz y cuadernos, asi mismo en su vivienda vende dulces al menudeo que complementan su oferta comercial. Productos que compra de contado, y vende a crédito y contado de lunes a domingo, de ocho (8) de la mañana a ocho (8) de la noche, a vecinos y amigos. Desde hace cuatro (4) años inició esta actividad, motivada por una hermana que tiene una miscelánea y una tienda. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de blusas, jean, lápices y cuadernos. Con ello espera mejorar la imagen del negocio, con un mayor surtido. Sus metas son: Aumentar sus ventas, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 38-year-old single mother who lives with her 14-year-old son in the town of Malambo in Atlántico Department. Their home is near banks of the Magdalena River, the main waterway in Colombia. Malamba gets its name from the historical Pedro Malambo, took the name of a tree that grew abundantly along the Caribbean coast, called euphorbiaceae croton malambo. 

In this town with its historically interesting name, Liliana lives and supports herself and her son. Liliana runs a business selling blouses, jeans, lipstick, and compacts to friends and neighbors on weekdays, as well as often selling candy to complement her business offerings. Liliana pays for these goods in cash and sells them either for cash or on credit. Liliana began the business four years ago, inspired by the example of her sister, the owner of a general store and a shop. 

This is Liliana's first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation]. She will use the loan funds to purchase blouses, jeans, lipstick, and compacts. Liliana hopes that a greater inventory will improve the business's image. Her goals rare to boost sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, jeans, lipstick, and compacts.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits cosmétiques pour revendre, madame Akouwa fait sa troisième demande à WAGES. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra de réinvestir dans son activité et d'assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille. Elle est mariée à un artiste plasticien et maman d'un enfant de 10ans scolarisé. Akouwa âgée de 35ans a une ancienneté de 11ans dans l'activité.
texts.en: In order to buy cosmetic products to resell, Madam Akouwa is making her third request to WAGES. The profit from the sales will allow her to reinvest in her business and to ensure the vital needs of her family. She is married to a visual artist and mother to a 10 year old child who goes to school. Akouwa is 35 years old and has 11 years experience in her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Sobeida

texts.es: Sobeida, de 44 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes son mayores de edad. El trabajo de Sobeida consiste en la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir, por eso tiene instalado su modesto taller en un espacio de su casa, se dedica básicamente a confeccionar sábanas y fundas de almohadas, pero también elabora camisas o blusas. Se inició comprando una máquina de coser y algunos materiales necesarios para realizar las prendas. Todo ello lo pudo obtener con el dinero que tenía ahorrado cuando trabajaba vendiendo comida, función que aún cumple de forma rutinaria. Lleva ya casi 20 años en ésta actividad y le va bien ya que le genera buenas ganancias. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar su creatividad con total destreza en cada una de las prendas que elabora, le agrada ver la satisfacción de sus clientes al recibir la vestimenta en perfecto estado. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará todos los materiales que necesita para confeccionar sus prendas y sábanas tales como hilos, elásticos, blondas y telas.
texts.en:
Sobeida is 44 years old, and she lives with her husband and their two grown children in their own home. Sobeida operates a sewing business out of a small workshop in her house. The most popular products she makes are sheets and pillow cases, along with shirts and blouses. She started her business with the purchase of a sewing machine and a few fabrics and materials, and her operation has grown ever since. Up until now, Sobeida has been able to purchase all the necessary materials for her business with money she had saved up from the past 20 years of working at her food sales business. She still works on the side selling food to generate additional income.

The aspect Sobeida likes best about her sewing business is the freedom it gives her to exercise her creativity and dexterity in each garment she makes. She also loves seeing the gratitude and excitement on her clients' faces when they receive their new clothes. Sobeida is grateful for the financial support that this loan represents, and she promises to make all scheduled repayments on time. With the support from this loan, Sobeida plans to purchase materials or use in her sewing business, including fabric, elastics bands, doilies and thread.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials such as thread, elastic bands, doilies and fabric for her sewing business.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem is an Iraqi youth client who is 22 years old. He is married and has a single child. Hatem's parents and his two brothers also live with him, and each of them takes part in providing for the family’s needs.

Hatem runs a shop where he sells all types of supplies like pencils, pens, books and calculators. He also sells magazines and newspapers. He established his business in 2012 and has developed good experience in this field. Hatem has a good reputation in his neighborhood and has gained his customers' respect.

Hatem is requesting a youth loan of $1,200. He will use it to renovate his shop and buy a new photocopying machine. In the future, he hopes to expand his shop, so that he may be able to educate his child and provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and buy a new photocopying machine

loans.name: Kaliya

texts.ru: Калие 65 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитала 4 детей. У Калии - средне-специальное образование, пенсионерка. Трое детей находятся на заработках в России, помогают Калие материально, младший сын проживает с матерью и активно помогает в хозяйстве. Калия в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калии и младшего сына, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Калия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kaliya is a 65-year old widow who raised four children alone after the death of her husband.  She is a pensioner and has a high school education.  Three of her children are migrant workers in Russia and they help Kaliya by sending money home, and her youngest son lives with his mother and actively helps her around the house.  As the main source of income for her family, Kaliya raises livestock, which she started doing 20 years ago by purchasing livestock for 15,000 som KGS.  Thanks to the hard work of Kaliya and her youngest son, their farm now has one dairy cow and 20 head of sheep and goats, which bring in a monthly income of 3,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Kaliya has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to increase her head of livestock by buying sheep and goats.  She plans to use the income from this loan to increase her herd even further.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара 26 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают  2 детей. У Чынары - среднее образование. Чынара в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, а также 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки нескольких голов мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Chynara is 26 years old and is married with two children.  She has a high school education and her main source of income for the family is livestock.  She started this business five years ago with the purchase of livestock for 12,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Chynara now has two cows and 20 sheep and goats which bring her a monthly income of 4,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Chynara has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) so increase her head of livestock by buying a few sheep and goats.  She plans to use the income from this business to increase her herd even more, and she plans to save up some money to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Comfort is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starchy, powdered cassava), maize, and wood planks. She usually sells her products in Ankyenyin (near Takoradi). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Gari,’ maize, and wood for 18 years. Comfort is married and has three children. Her husband works as a security officer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Comfort wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, she will be able to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Gari.’ In the long term, Comfort has plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and satisfy the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, which will enable her to sell more 'Gari'

loans.name: Rolito

texts.en: Rolito is a 32 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is the father of an eight year old child. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has been fishing for almost 5 years. Rolito needs materials to improve his catch to augment his income. He requested a loan of 6000 PHP to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, paint and epoxy (adhesive). In the future, Rolito would like to improve his fishing business to support his family and provide good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, paint and epoxy (adhesive)

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en: Faustine  is single and has five children. After going through middle school, Faustine dropped out of school to trade since she could not further her education due to financial constraints. Faustine is now an established businesswoman. She used to sell plastics but currently she sells provisions in Ankyenyin (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years now. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Faustine uses her income to provide for the entire family. Faustine will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustine plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: To purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants de 09 et 07ans à Lomé. Elle est informaticienne et revend aussi des matériels informatiques. Pour pouvoir mieux répondre  aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite son premier prêt à WAGES pour acheter une machine photocopieuse. Le profit lui permettra d'élargir son activité et d'améliorer les besoins de la famille. Elle a 37ans et a démarré en 2008.
texts.en: Adjovi lives with her spouse and their 2 children who are 9 and 7 years old in Lomé. She is a computer specialist and also resells computing materials. To be able to better respond to the needs of her clients, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy a photocopier. The profits will allow her to expand her business and to improve to needs of her family. She is 37 years old and started her business in 2008.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise vit à Lomé avec sa famille(mariée et mère de 03 enfants). Depuis 2000, elle a démarré la vente des céréales,activité qu'elle mène au marché. Confrontée au problème de concurrence à son lieu d'activité, Louise désire garder ses clients c'est pour cela elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Après la vente, le profit lui permettra de louer un magasin pour stocker plus et contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Louise lives in Lomé with her family (married and mother to 3 children). Since 2000, she started selling cereals, a business that she conducts at the market. Confronted by the problem of competition at the site of her business, Louise wants to keep her customers. It's because of this that she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise. After the sales, the profits will allow her to rent a shop to stock up more and contribute to the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Honorine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Honorine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Honorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Honorine est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Louis. Le couple a deux enfants, tous  scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leur propre enfant, le couple a également un enfant à sa charge. Honorine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage, sont supportées par Honorine et son mari. C'est pour cette raison que Honorine vend depuis neuf ans de la nourriture(riz, pâte accompagné de sauce) à son domicile. Honorine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Honorine s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group is represented by Honorine, age 49, seen in the photo with her hand raised. 

Honorine never went to school. She is married to a car mechanic named Louis, and they have two dependent children who go to school. They also have a third child in their care. Honorine lives with her husband and the children, and the couple provide for their household together. To that end, Honorine has been selling food (rice, pasta with sauce) from her home for the past nine years. She buys her supplies at a market in Bénin. 

To bolster her working capital, Honorine is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy condiments and rice.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad, a 31-year-old grocer from Iraq, is a married father of two children, working hard to provide for his family. In his grocery store Iyad sells soft drinks, dairy products, canned food, pickles and detergents. As a child he spent most of his time in his father’s grocery store, thereby gaining much experience in this field. 


In 2012, Iyad established his own independent business. He now has one employee and is well-known in the market, having earned his customers’ respect.


Iyad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD in order to pay the annual rent of his grocery store. He is aiming to grow more in this field so that one day he may open a second grocery store and increase his profits so as to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is an Iraqi client. He is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. Khaled is the sole provider of the family. 
Khaled owns a small shop where he sells and changes engine oils and filters. He has been in this field since 2007 and has gained much experience. Khaled's business has been growing fast in his neighborhood and he has been gaining an excellent reputation. 
Khaled is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. Khaled is aiming to improve his business and increase his profits so he is able to educate his children and take care of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 51 год, замужем, многодетная мать имеет 5 детей. Образование-среднее. После окончания средней школы Бурулкан вышла замуж совсем в юном возрасте. С 1993 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20,000 сом KGS. Супруг Бурулкан –пастух, пасет домашний скот жителей своего села. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 3 лошади. Прибыль позволила Бурулкан размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Бурулкан  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также накопить средства для обучения дочери в высшем учебном заведении.
texts.en: Burulkan is 51 years old, married and a mother many times over - she has five children.  She has a high school education.  After she finished school, Burulkan married at a very young age.  Since 1993, she has been farming and raising livestock, a business she started with 20,000 som KGS.  Her husband is a shepherd, driving herds for the other residents in their village.  Thanks to her hard work, Burulkan now has a good farm with two dairy cows, 20 sheep and three horses.  The income from the farm has allowed Burulkan to increase the herd on her farm and to improve her family's well-being.  With the goal of developing her business further, Burulkan has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy cows.  She plans to use the income from this business to increase her herd even more, and she plans to save up some money for her daughter's college education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Nelda Nohemi

texts.es:
Nelda es una joven de 22 años de edad la cual está acompañada y es madre de 2 hijos, agricultora y ama de casa desde hace más de 3 años. En compañía de su compañero de hogar ella trabaja el cultivo de hortalizas especialmente papa ya que fue su pareja quien le ensenara a trabajar la tierra. El terreno que cultivan es propio gracias a una herencia familiar por parte de los padres del conyugue la cual está ubicada a una distancia de camino de 10 minutos de su casa de habitación. En su casa de habitación solo viven ellos 4 y sus 2 hijos no estudian ya que ambos están pequeños. Ella tiene un nivel de educación secundaria cursado hasta el 3 de ciclo común básico.

Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento con el cual planea comprar para asistir sus cultivos de papa: 1 QQ de abono, 1 QQ de nitrato de amonio, 2 QQ de semilla de papa certificada para poder cultivar y extender más sus siembras con lo cual dará mantenimiento a sus cultivos, atraerá más clientes y podrá generar mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder arreglar su casa de habitación ya que necesita mejoras para mayor seguridad. Sus sueños es poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad, que se especialicen en una carrera que los convierta en profesionales exitosos y pueden tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nelda is 22 years old and has many responsibilities as a wife, mother of two children, farmer and housewife. She and her husband work together to cultivate and farm potatoes and other vegetables. Her husband has taught her many farming techniques, and they presently farm a parcel of land 10 minutes from their home that was passed down to them by her husband's parents. Their family of four lives together, since their two children are very young and not yet in school. Nelda was able to complete three years of her high school education before children and household responsibilities became her top priorities.

With the support from this loan, Nelda plans to purchase agricultural input products for her farming operation, including manure, ammonium nitrate, potato seeds and other items. She hopes that this investment will help her to expand her farming operation, increase her customer base and generate more income to support her family. 

Her future plans are to add a room on to her family's home to improve their quality of life and security. Her dream is to send her children to university so they can pursue professional careers and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for tending her potato crops.

loans.name: Appoline Marie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Appoline Marie(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Appoline Marie n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Appoline Marie est mariée à Marcel. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Appoline Marie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour ce faire, Appoline Marie, vend des produits cosmétiques depuis dix sept ans. Appoline Marie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, et de fidéliser sa clientèle Appoline Marie s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group consists of four people who live in the same neighborhood. The leader of the group, named Appoline Marie (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 53 years old. Appoline Marie did not go to school. Appoline Marie is married to Marcel. The couple has five children, all in school and one under their care. Appoline Marie lives with her husband and their children. The couple takes care of the household responsibilities together. To do this, Appoline Marie has been selling cosmetic products for seventeen years. Appoline Marie gets her supplies in a market of Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and to gain the loyalty of her clientele, Appoline Marie joined the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She used to sell gari (a food item made from cassava), but currently she sells soft drinks in Ankyenyin (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Esi is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Esi will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Raisa's Group

texts.en:
In Raisa's Group, Raisa is representing herself as a group leader. She is very conscious about managing, controlling, and handling people. In fact, she is a general storekeeper and she deals with different people, of different mentalities, everyday. She is taking responsibility of her group members and has assured that repayments will be made. 

Raisa is a very old and honest borrower of BRAC Pakistan. Now, she is in her fourth loan cycle. She has invested the previous three loans in her current enterprise. She has established her general store through these loan amounts. She has paid back her third loan and wants to be a member of BRAC Pakistan. 

Now, she wants to take a fourth loan, for the growth of her general store. Through the new loan, she will buy stocks of flour, pulses, rice, detergents, biscuits, and chocolates.

Raisa is 46 years old. Her husband is a security guard. Her 16-year-old son is studying for matriculation and, in the afternoon, he helps his mother in her daily activities.

Raisa feels proud to be a member of BRAC Pakistan. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, pulses, rice, detergents, biscuits, and chocolates to sell.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is an Iraqi client who is 42 years old, married and the father of five children. Hamza and two of his children work to provide for the family’s needs, while the other three continue their education. 


Hamza is a carpenter who specializes in making bedrooms and living rooms. Working in this field since 1998, Hamza has gained good experience, and thanks to his good work, he has become well-known in the community. 


Hamza is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent for his carpentry business. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can take better care of his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina is a member of PMPC for one year. She is 40 years old, and married with three children.  

Sabrina is a farmer, and raises pigs to earn a living in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines. She has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional feeds and other agricultural veterinary supplies.
In the future, Sabrina hopes to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and other agricultural veterinary supplies

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is a hard-working client, 40 years of age, who is married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Raed is a blacksmith. He started working in this field in his youth, and after having a good experience he established his own business in 2012. He has a hired employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400. He will use it to renovate his blacksmith shop and to buy more raw materials. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his blacksmith shop and to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Wangninou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WANGNINOU 1 est composé de dix sept membres qui dans le même village. La représentante  de ce groupement, du nom de Solange(est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Solange est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Roger. Le couple a cinq enfants,dont certains scolarisé et trois sont à leur charge. Solange vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Depuis dix ans, Solange exerce comme activité la vente de maïs et du gari(farine de manioc) dans a région. Solange s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Solange ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement WANGNINOU 1 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est développé son activité afin de devenir un grossiste.
texts.en: The group WANGNINOU 1 consists of seventeen members who live in the same town. The leader of this group, named Solange (the one with one hand raised in the photo) is 37 years old. With the goal of raising the level of their business in order to better meet the demands of their clientele, this group is requesting financial suppport from ALIDé for the first time. Solange is married to a farmer named Roger. The couple has five children, of whom certain ones go to school and three are under their care. Solange lives together with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the household responsibilities together. For ten years, Solange has been in business selling corn and gari (manioc flour) in her region. Solange gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and satisfying her clientele, Solange, together with the other members of the WANGNINOU 1 group, is requesting a first loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to develop her business in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy corn and gari (manioc flour).

loans.name: Djiguiya (Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes  de la ville de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habits, condiments, du poisson, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. 
Oumou est un membre du groupe Djiguiya accroupi avec deux poissons en main.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter du poisson de mer. Elle se procure de ces articles  au grand marché.  Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de100.715 CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Oumou compte réaliser  104 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women from the city of Koutiala who all live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 32 years of age, and they are married with at least four children each. 

This group is engaged in the small trade of miscellaneous items such as clothing, condiments, fish, etc. To expand their activities, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program. This is their 6th group loan cycle. 

Oumou is a member of Djiguiya. She is seen in the front of the photo holding two fish. She plans to use her loan to buy saltwater fish. She buys her stock at the Grand market, and she sells at retail for cash to a diverse clientele, from her home and at the market. 

While the other members of the group Djiguiya expect to earn an average profit of 100,715FCFA each during this cycle, Oumou expects to earn 104,000FCFA.

In addition to repaying their loans, the group members will use part of their income to cover personal expenses and to bolster their working capital.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Banan

texts.en:
Banan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

She is a 19-year-old married woman from Dier El-Balah. Her husband is a worker in the public sector and earns a low income that is not enough to cover the family's needs. She lives with her husband in an old rental house, but now they are building a new home that will provide them with better living conditions. Banan and her husband would like to complete their home so they can live in it as soon as possible.
 
Banan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of purchasing cement and iron to complete building their home. By receiving this loan, Banan and her husband will be able to complete their home faster and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement and iron to complete building their home

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman and a mother of four children. She lives at Dauis, Bohol. She has been engaged in a furniture-making business with her husband, for more than seven years. This is the source of their income.

Mildred is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy materials for making furniture. These include wood, varnish, and nails. With these, they will be able to produce more furniture, and therefore they may sell more. Mildred hopes to expand her business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children, and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making furniture, including wood, varnish, and nails

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is 23 years old, married, and lives with his parents.  He is a youth client from Iraq. Haydar and his father provide the family’s monthly income together.

Haydar is a carpenter. After gaining his experience from a former, well-known carpenter in the market, he established his own business in 2012. He acquired good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. 

Haydar is requesting a youth loan for $2,400, which he will use to buy a machine for cutting wood and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for cutting wood and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Isata.  She is married and has one child, aged 2 years. In 2005, Isata established her slippers and sandals business. She began her business as a source of generating revenue, to be self-reliant. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isata requires a loan in order to buy cartons of slippers and sandals to sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 600,000. In the future, Isata plans to rent a shop, in order to sell at wholesale. A very hard-working woman, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of slippers and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Jabalia. Her husband works in a local company and earnss a low wage. 

Yousra is requesting a loan from FATEN, which she will use to buy the necessary home furniture. This loan will help Yousra to improve the home conditions and live in a comfortable place.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Athour

texts.en:
Athour is a married Iraqi client, who is 48 years old and has two children. Athour works hard to provide for his family all by himself.

Athour owns a carpenter’s shop. He has been practicing carpentry for more than twenty years. He specializes in making furniture. Athour established his own business in 2000 and has gained good experience in this field. He now has an employee. He is well-known in his neighborhood, thanks to his competitive prices.

Athour is applying for a loan of 2,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy a motor generator, in order to increase his production. Athour is aiming to expand in this field and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator, which will enable him to increase his productivity

loans.name: Bahae

texts.en:
Bahae, who is 23 years old, is an Iraqi youth client who is married and has a single child. He is the only provider in the family. 

Bahae owns a small shop selling mobile phones and their accessories. In his shop, he has a wide collection of all known mobiles in the market and also all their accessories, like headsets and covers. He also provides services like downloading music and ringtones as well as selling charging cards. He established his business in 2010, and since then, he has been well known in the market and has gained a good reputation. 

Bahae is requesting a $3,000 youth loan. This loan will be used to install a rolling shutter, a display window and signage for his shop. Bahae aims to grow his business and increase his assets so he may provide more services and make more income and be able to provide his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, a display window and signage for his shop

loans.name: David Horacio

texts.es:
David, es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad por su actividad económica y por sus principios, vive actualmente con su compañera de vida, no tiene hijos y asimismo no posee familiares en el extranjero. El se dedica al servicio de transporte de carga, lo realiza desde hace 12 años y cuenta que sale a las 4:00am hasta en la tarde que regresa según la distancia del viaje, dicha actividad la aprendió por iniciativa propia por la misma necesidad económica, ventaja que posee es que cuenta con maquinaria adecuada.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar llantas, lubricantes, entre otros para el mantenimiento de la maquinaria. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener su equipo de trabajo estable y en buenas condiciones para realizar los viajes; uno de los riesgos es un posible accidente de transito.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para obtener mejores ganancias económicas y en el futuro adquirir otro camión; asimismo desea brindarles una mejor calidad a su esposa y a futuros hijos.
texts.en:
David is a person who is well-known in his community for his business activity and his principles.  He currently lives with his life companion, but they have no children.  In addition, he has no relatives who are living abroad.  David provides cargo transport services and has been doing this for 12 years.  He leaves at 4:00 A.M. and returns sometime in the afternoon based on the distance of his trips.  David learned this trade on his own because he needed to earn an income.  The advantage that he possesses is that he has adequate machinery.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tires, lubricants, and other supplies that he needs to maintain his machinery.  This investment will help him to maintain his work equipment so that it remains stable and in good condition for making his trips.  Otherwise, he takes the risk of having an accident while in transit.  

His dream is to continue working so that he can earn more income.  In the future, he would like to acquire another truck.  He would also like to provide a better quality of life for his wife and any future children.

loans.use: to buy tires, lubricants, and other supplies.

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en:
This is Qasem’s second loan cycle from Ryada. His previous loan helped him develop his business with a positive outcome, and he was able to complete his education at the university. 

Today, Qasem is planning to keep developing his business to make sure that his customers are satisfied. So he decided to request this loan to purchase an air conditioner, and redecorate his café.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner and redecorate his cafe.

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is a 29-year-old, married woman from Jenin city. She is a mother for three sons and three daughters. Safa's husband is a worker in a local factory. His job is very hard, and he must work long hours to provide his family with all the necessities.

For the past three years, Safa has been working on a small farm she owns. She plants okra on her farm. it is a profitable project, but Safa needs some money to develop it. She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more okra seeds, and a water tank for irrigation. By applying this loan, Safa will be able to develop her farm and increase the family's income. 

Safa and her son appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy okra seeds, and a water tank for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 21 years old. He lives in the town of Kutaisi with his family: wife and mother who works as a tailor at the local workshop. 

Lasha is unemployed at the moment. He can’t find an appropriate and moneymaking job to generate an income. The family lives below the poverty line and gets a small social assistance from the local government (nearly 33 USD per month). 

As the family has many expenses and existing funds are not enough to cover them, Lasha decided to start a business. He requested credit to set up a cobbler shop. Lasha used to work as a cobbler and has enough experience in this field. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Lasha will purchase leather materials and all the needed tools for shoe-making. He will also repair shoes and get a profit. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income for the family. Their living conditions will improve, and in the future they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start a cobbler shop to make and repair shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy video tapes and movies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, who is 23 years old, is a single youth client from Iraq, who lives with his family, composed of four members. Ali and his father provide the family's income, while his brothers continue their studies. 

Ali owns a small shop where he sells women’s outfits. He established his business in 2012 and has gained good experience in this field through previous work at a similar shop, as an employee, until he established his own business. He now has hired an employee and has gained an excellent reputation, thanks to the good quality and the affordable prices of his products.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of USD 3,000 which will be used to buy more clothes to sell, to install an air conditioner, and provide signage and a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he will be able keep helping his family and to provide himself with a stable career.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell, to install an air conditioner, and provide signage and a rolling shutter for his business.

loans.name: Jessica Beatríz

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo de 8 años que esta estudiando 2° grado y con la mamá, persona de aproximadamente 50 años que se dedicó a realizar actividades de comercio.


Jessica,  aprendió a elaborar  tortillas a los 14 años de edad,  en el  negocio en  que su mamá se trabajó; pero, manifiesta que se dedicó a tiempo completo desde hace  9 años  y que fue cuando quedo embarazada de su hijo, en este tiempo estaba estudiando el  2° año de bachillerato. Todos los días  muele unas 75 libras de maíz.   Comercializa las tortillas en la colonia donde reside vende una parte al medio día y por la tarde.

El préstamo servirá para pagar un saldo pendiente de pago a Fundación Campo por $391.00,  y para comprar leña $100.00 y en compra de 7 sacos de maíz  $210. Con la compra de  maíz en esta fecha le permitirá ahorrar, en pago de flete y por que el grano está subiendo de precio.

Su sueño, es establecer un negocio de venta de ropa o una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Jessica is 27 years old, and she lives with her 8-year-old son and her mother, a wise woman with decades of business experience. Jessica learned to make tortillas at her mother's business when she was 14 years old. Nine years ago, when she was in her second year of college and found out she was pregnant with her son, she decided to transition to working full time in the tortilla business. Every day she grinds 75 pounds of corn into flour for making tortillas, and she sells the tortillas she makes in her neighborhood in two shifts, one at mid-day and the other in the afternoon.

With the support from this loan, Jessica plans to purchase firewood and 7 sacks of corn for making her tortillas, as well as pay off an outstanding balance of $391.00 to Fundación Campo. She hopes that this investment will help her to take advantage of current corn prices, since the price of corn is rising steadily. Jessica's dream is to one day open her own clothing business or a store in her house.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and 7 sacks of corn, as well as pay off a balance owed to Fundación Campo.

loans.name: Baha

texts.en:
Baha is a 27-year-old, single man from a small village. He has a small farm in the village where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and he sells them in the local market. Baha also has a small store in the village where he sells these crops to this village and the villages nearby. 

Baha took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Baha to buy a big refrigerator for his store, to keep the crops for a longer time. This will improve his store and increase his income. 

Baha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a big refrigerator for his store, to keep the crops for a longer time.
